text: This place is great, purchased a hot tub there a few yrs back and would again. The husband and wife owners are always friendly and helpful along with their staff. Have had a few normal wear 'n tear problems with my tub as its over 5 yrs old now but Ryan the service guy/owner is always quick to service and rates are always fair. Super helpful with advice and locally owned. They care about their reputation and you can tell. Judge for yourself and give them a shot if you're in the market for a hot tub or service call.

I've recently moved to Airdrie so have been slowly trying out some of the local pubs and restaurants.

My husband and I decided to give pour beer market a try and go for drinks and appies. My first impression of this place was less than stellar. First off there was a group of somewhat shady looking men smoking right outside the entrance. After walking through the cloud of smoke we entered the somewhat desolate looking bar. It was a Wednesday evening and mostly empty except for what looked to be a few regulars who stared at us when we came in like we didn't belong there. I also noticed that the layout of the bar was kind of odd without much flow and had a bit of a dirty look to it.

We quickly found a table and the waitress was prompt getting our drinks, though they were all out of the beer that was supposed to be on special. Also for a place called "pour beer market" I was underwhelmed with the beer selection. We then decided to take a look at the menu and my appetite was kind of turned off by the dirty menu. We ordered the nachos since there really wasn't much that appealed to us on the menu and nothing really unique. The nachos were your standard pub nachos, nothing to complain about there. We decided against ordering any more beer since we just weren't enjoying the atmosphere and the weird dance music.

All in all I would not return.

The pizza is from scratch & it tastes it. They have Erdinger Hefe on tap so I'm in love. They weather is finally nice here so the patio is awesome. I just wish it would get dark earlier. It's kinda weird kickin' it when it's so bright out.

Pour Beer Market is a HUGE improvement on what used to be in this location. 
The ambiance is great. The restaurant is tastefully decorated. 

The waitstaff are generally really good, and they work very hard. Sometimes it seems like it takes forever to get your beer/food/water but keeping in mind this isn't necessarily your servers fault, maybe the manager should have more staff on during peak times. 

The food is fantastic. Either myself or my friends have tried a variety of things on the menu and none of us have been disappointed.

A great place to enjoy a great selection of beers on tap, either local or worldwide. Many beers are available by the bottle, some of them are really unique and hard to find. This place is nowhere near the level of Craft Beer Market (in Calgary, Edmonton, Vancouver, etc), but certainly a better selection than probably all other pubs in Airdrie. I will come back.

Vietnamese food isn't a staple in my diet, so I am going to struggle a little bit with some of my review. I ordered a combo 4 that was rice, ginger beef, and vegetables. I was in a group of four that ordered. It was very prompt service as we are across town and phoned in our order. It was ready in 10-12 minutes as that's what he told us and the drive took us that long at least. 
The beef in my dish was really good. Served with white rice that I doused in the accompanying sweet chili sauce. The mixed vegetables were el dente and just way way the should be so they aren't a soggy mess by the time you get back home.

The Gold standard for Calmari. Very lightly breaded, excellent tzatziki sauce and cooked to an amazing tenderness. 
Bratwurst and mashed were gently seasoned. The sausage was quite lean and not greasy. 
The Black & Blue was full of flavour, with just the right amount blue cheese. I did find the beef patty slightly over done for my taste. 
Don't miss the extensive beer menu. The sampler paddle gives you four 5oz draft choices. 
A bit on the noisy side, but great for groups.
Great food, great service.  Love the Deep fried Dill Pickles, and the Parmesan Wings!  Bonus points for being within stumbling distance to home.

Very impressive!

Surprisingly amazing food, great service, good beer selection, definitely the best of its kind in Airdrie. It's a good place for singles, but I find the beer can be sometimes warm...

I am so happy we found this place!!! We live a in Canmore and had business in Red Deer. We stopped at this place and boy what a treat. The place is so clean, great service, nice decor and great food!!! You will not be disappointed !!!!

This is for the location..

The name of this establishment is mispelled, it should be POOR. Poor service, poor food quality and poor dining experience!  Service was extremely slow, An hour for any food to appear and when it did the butter chicken was horrible. Rubbery chicken and mushy rice.  The manager actually told us he had three or for complaints about the chicken over the past three or for days about the chicken being rubbery. Don't you think that it kinda the first clue to do something about it?? Here is a hint, stopping using frozen chicken laden with water. Won't be back, ever!

Today's just our second time at Smitty's. I got a $10 coupon which I got on our first time at the East Hills location. We wanted to dine at Smitty's East Hills but it was out pf way to where we plan to head after so we ended up in Airdrie. 

My apologies if my review would seem like a comparison to East Hills. I just cant help it. It was Sunday and it was raining. I understand it could get very busy. But there was no greeter when we came in. Customers were beginning to pile up by the entrance. Server came and managed the crown well. I just didn't get her name but she was nice and very apologetic. 

We enjoyed the buffet over at East Hills so we thought to do it again this time in Airdrie. Again wrong decision. The buffet entrees was so few it's not really worth the price. Bacon would always run out and it would take forever for it to get replenished. It almost fees like we're being forced to have sausages instead. 

The service wasn't really good too except for the lady who helped us initially at the front. We were seated by another server who, after giving us our drinks, never came back to ask if we needed something else like say "cuttleries" and/or "table napkins"? We were only given those until we asked another server who just brought in forks and knives without the napkins and placed them at the table just like that. 

Service wasn't good (except for only one person)...food wasn't good...so what can I say? Im not coming back to this location. And I will not recommend it to others as well.

Would not recommend they only care about the money.  Took 3 artist to get the work done . One quit one started then said he couldn't do it the third charge an arm and a leg  did not heal properly and received major infection.

Zenbu is a nice little family run sushi restaurant in the heart of Airdrie.  The food is good, the staff are pleasant, the space is clean and open.

As usual, I ordered Edemame, Salmon Sashimi, Tuna Sashimi (white only no red!), Salmon Maki, Vegetable Maki (Avocado, Cucumber, Carrot), and a few other relatively clean maki roll variations.

Zenbu is a solid good.

Decided to have dinner here based on the yelp reviews and was not disappointed.  

They have a great beer selection and the waitress (Tia) was great offering suggestions right away without prompting.  I settled on the berries and cream which was a mix of fruli strawberry and velvet fog (wheat beer) I'm not a beer drinker and this was sooooo good.  Not too sweet but didn't have the beer taste that I dislike.

My friend and I both ordered the personal pizza since they were half off on Wednesday.  I got the carne and it was good but a touch on the salty side.  Also all of the sauce was pushed towards the crust.  My friend got the margherita pizza and he said if it didn't have cheddar on it that it would have been superb but he still liked it. 

Service was really fast and quite friendly.  I would definitely dine here again as they have a very good menu.

Always enjoy the breakfast special. Staff have always been magnificent. Food tastes great. I enjoy the diner and the atmosphere here. Only ever had breakfast here. Several times and never disappointed.

This place has a bunch of beer menu including some non-alcohol. The server was very nice and friendly.
Foods are good too. My wife had a vegie burger with a big mushroom and tomato, it was really great. My fish tacos are so huge that I had a hard time to manage in a good way.
Only issue that make us give one less star out of 5 is the onion soup that was really salty. It might be over cooked or just old. but overall good and we will visit again
The sushi is extremely americanized and is not authentic at all. However, the food is not bad but I definitely would not consider this real sushi as it is so westernized.

I had a great experience at Embrace! Came in without an appointment to find a bridesmaid dress and the staff were friendly and helpful. My dress came in on time and the alterations ended up being finished a week early!  Very happy and would definitely recommend

We decided to visit Zenbu after shopping around Cross Iron Mills, since it wasn't too far of a drive.

The restaurant wasn't all too busy around lunch time so we were seated quickly and orders came quickly as well.

Our server was great and personable, very refreshing! The decor ambiance of the restaurant is not too bad and the dining area was clean.

We ordered  2 orders of takoyaki, dynamite roll, spicy tuna roll, California roll, and their Dragon roll. All the rolls and appetizers we ordered were good, but nothing special. They also have Korean food in their menu(ie. Bibimbap, Korean ramen, etc.), but we opted to just try out their sushi.

I think it's a decent place to get sushi in Airdrie if you live there, but I'm not too sure I would visit all the way from Calgary to eat there again.

I'm Japanese and I also like Korean foods. Overall I like this place. The raw fishes are quite good and fresh, and sushi rice is nicely steamed-cooked. so many other places even don't know how to properly cook steamed rice for sushi. Korean foods are great too as I believe most of workers there are Korean. Only thing I really could not accept is the seaweed salad with coloring that makes your tongue green eww. I hope they stop using that unnecessary coloring.

very good customer service. We'll visit again
A good place to be in. Sushi not the best but good and the rest of the food is great. The staff is great aswell. I'm not a big fan of japanese food but this one is by far the best one in airdrie

My boyfriend and I took our dog here a few months ago and it was terrible! They cut her ears and other spots on her head as well as a few spots on her back! Unfortunately we didn't noticed until we got home and she started whimpering every time we got close to her head! I know for a fact our dog is not squirmy so this shouldn't have happened but on top of that they never even told us! Very disappointed, we will never go back.

Went in for a walk in this weekend. Receptionist was nice and every artist was friendly but the one we directly spoke to. She was very rude and arrogant, explaining that visible "hand" tattoo's make you unemployable and that she would not do one out of the shop- Then said unless it was made by appointment. She gave us a talk that sounded more like a mother scolding her child, than it was a business talk between a client. Funny, cause the guy I went with to get our tattoos,, we both had sleeves and knuckles done, as well as ones all over our bodies that were covered by clothing.  We Guess we should have listened to our friends cause we have heard negative comments about her attitude before. Didn't appreciate the judgmental, rude attitude we were given and won't be back.

First visit: beer- awesome, food- yuck. 

I really loved their vast beer selection. 

My boyfriend and I ordered the Stromboli's (pizza pocket) and they were pretty gross. I ordered the margarita one and it was soooo watery. They should've gutted the tomato first because all the juice made the crust soggy and the flavours vague. My bf had the one with the bratwurst and had a similar problem. The juices from the sausage killed the flavour and made it soggy, and it was pretty inconsistent (so much cheese on one side and no meat, too much meat on the other side with no cheese). 

I would definitely come back for drinks but I'm not sure if I would eat here again.

Brady charged me for a deposite, I gave him pictures of a certain flower to make a design for me and I booked an appointment with him. He just sent me a sketch of a completely different flower. I told him that I didn't ask for this, so he canceled my appointment and told me that he will fix his mistake soon. I followed up a few times last few months, but he never gave me an answer. And when I ask for a reimbursement of my deposite, he just told me that when he canceled my appointment I didn't re-book another one. 

Bad customer service, bad design, bad attitude. I don't recommend this place at all.
My wife, My Parents and My Sister had the opportunity to visit this restaurant on opening night and despite opening night jitters, the food was excellent, the service was outstanding.

I recently moved to the area and since my husband loves different types of beers we gave this place a try. The decor is really beautifully designed and there are lots of TV screens which are great for watching sports. The food is quite good, the waitress told me that they make everything in house including the salad dressings and the food has been pretty good. I really like their salads but had the steak sandwich one evening and pizza the next. All fresh and tasty. The service has always been pretty good and I will totally go back.

After Our Last experience at Pour, We were very reluctant on trying it again.  But after speaking to Manager Tony, He reassured us that the service we had received was below their standards, and he would make our next dinning experience the best we ever had if we would give them a second chance.

Tonight we came in for dinner...
The service:  She was the center a the fantastic evening we had! she was friendly and professional! She new the menu extensively, and she was so humble and gracious!  
The Food; We started with the margheritta tarts, the flavor in this prefect little portion of cheesy tomato/basil was heaven in our mouths!!  My Husband had the Piri Piri Chicken w/Potato, The most amazing blend of citrus and spice, which they displayed beautifully across the plate.  I had the New York Steak cooked to perfection (Blue Rare)mouth-watering seasoned veggy, with a side ceasar accompanied with real bacon bits!!!!!! 

That was the best steak i have ever had in my life, my husband is still drooling over his chicken.  I was so very happy i was able to talk to Tony, he completely rebuilt our faith in The Pour Beer Market & Grill and we will be returning for dinner again, in the very near future. :D

The food was pretty good. 
Order the "Bucket of Bacon" for and appetizer, really how can you go wrong,  a bucket of bacon! Awesome! The bacon was thick slices and cooked, than covered with a brown sugar type candy coating. It was great.

The rest of the meal was likewise good, and well prepared, but it really is a bar / pub. So there were not a ton of choices on the menu. 

The offererd several beers on tap and promoted some local breweries.

All in all not a bad experience

We stopped in the first time in summer for a beer just to wait for the shuttle to the Airdrie Rodeo... which met in front, and were pleased at the selection on tap. I recently ended up back here for lunch, after working outside for the morning in -34 weather and had the Craft Dinner....  WOW!  In the menu it is described thus: "Maplewood smoked bacon, chorizo sausage, mozzarella, cheddar, jack cheese, jalapeño, frizzled onion, and garlic toast." It sounded good to me, but didn't look like anything fancy, honestly. The blend of textures and flavours was a surprise, presenting and tasting like quite the masterpiece  when I thought I was just ordering a standard (see what I did there?) pub comfort dish to combat the cold weather, and I will definitely order it again. The servers were pleasant.  In summer, with the garage doors open, it is breezy and pleasant, and on this visit it was warm and inviting.

The beef sate was good, broth was flavorful and I thought they were generous with the meat portions. It was definitely better than other places I've tried in town.

I haven't had anything else on the menu but I saw cream cheese wontons ?! Um yes, I will definitely be back to try those! 

My only concern was I felt soooo ridiculously full & bloated after. Could be a coincidence but it made me wonder if they use a ton of msg. I guess I'll find out next time!

Service for take-out was wonderful. Portion size was good, taste was good.
I had a #19 which consisted of char-grilled pork and spring rolls. I was disappointed when I got home (my own fault) as I could have sworn that I had ordered tiger prawns with my dish but I guess I chose the wrong number on the menu. There was too much pork for me in the dish and the taste was... OK, not great. The spring rolls were average.
I would certainly come back here but would get chicken and shrimp next time.
The dining room is your typical Vietnamese casual feel type place -  my preference would be to stick to take-out here.
Great location on the main drag in Airdrie with great signage which is what prompted me to stop in here.

Sorry- not sorry, you lost my business today when the person I spoke to on the phone was incredibly rude. 

I had called several times in the morning to make an appointment and kept on getting voicemail, so I left a message. No one called me back so after waiting several hours I called back yet again since I really needed to book an appointment. Even had to go online and double check operation hours! 

The person who then answered the phone informed me there was no receptionist "in" today. Your business' lack of staff and planning is not my problem, you don't need to be rude to your clients.

I spend about $250 every appointment and unfortunately, my stylist has whoever answered the phone, to blame for her loss.

Unbelievably rude and unproffessional! They would not honor a groupon that they have posted, they would not offer feedback on what size of storage I would need, the lady on the phone said she had more important customers to deal with and if i was not going to commit i was wasting her time! I never signed a contract and the assured me they wouldn't charge me until I did but they went ahead and charged the full amount before I could even get out there to sign the contract. When I went to cancel they said they do not do cancellations so either way I would have to suck up the charge for 1 month and use the storage or not that was my choice. I DO NOT RECOMEND THIS BUSINESS!

A nice selection of beer on tap and in bottle, few wines. The food was good and our server had some good insight into the menu. Only a few local breweries on tap and a bummer is there is only one dessert on the menu.

A lot of televisions to watch sports and it was a bit empty on a Saturday evening.

Overall a nice place to grab a beer and some good food.

they might be good at installing and following thru with hot tubs, but ryan is a complete a...hole when it comes to rubaroc installation service. 1st tells me a 2 week install timeline, comes on site 2 days after phone call to set up meeting, states 3 weeks to install, 3 days later was suppose to email a quote, didn't hear anything so emailed to inquire only to find out he can't do the job at all during the season, albeit he says another job starts at monthend and goes a week into aug??????? hello it's only jun 1st what happened to the other 3 1/2 weeks avail in jun....not impressed w/his business ethics or practices, no bs excuses. On top of this he had some very negative comments to say about the company paying for the service, very unprofessional to say negative hearsay about another company. Especially knowing there is a safety issue between the pavers and pool bullnose, little kids getting their fingers caught in the gaps while getting out of the pool...so not impressed.

First time here, and we got in around 7:30 on a weeknight. The place was quiet, so we grabbed a booth in a vacant part of the bar.

The waitress got to us quickly, and the specials were quite good, but we opted to browse the drink menu and just share some appys. The bar has a very good beer selection, with a few hard to find picks as well. In a huge fan of Granville Island's Lion Winter Ale, and it was I tap, so grabbed a pint. My boyfriend got an IPA, and our friend grabbed a fruity beer, and contented ourselves looking at the menu. The waitress was super attentive, and took our orders quickly. 

The apps we got we're good, but not fantastic. Veggie platter was large and with a good variety, but the broccoli was sad and limp, and some of the veggies were a bit flavorless. The fried pickle spears we ordered were also pretty good, with about 8 spears on a beer batter - not the best I've had (better with less batter), but I'd order them again. 

Overall, a good experience. 4/5, taking a star for the veggie plate.

Ok ladies this is a consumer warning!!! About Embrace Alterations in Airdrie!!! I took my brand new wedding dress to them to get alterations. I took it to them brand new never out of the bag! When I showed up they were extremely unprofessional but that's not the end... My dress which was over $10,000 came back to me filled with hair, thread, and pieces of fabric on it!!!.. There was also a huge black oil stain on it!!! it still doesn't end there!! While I was totally destroyed after picking up my dress I said to the consultant I could leave it with them for a few more days as my wedding was 8 days away so they could steam it for me! Not only would they tell I would have to pay for it!!! But I also had to pay extra for them to pick off all the stuff they clearly put on my dress!! I was mortified after already paying over $200.00 for the alterations I would have to pay for them to fix my dress that they dirtied!!! Fuming at this time I just took my dress and left! After a day I called them( I needed to relax and take a breath) asked to speak to the manager!! She told me they were not responsible for steaming nor the cleaning of my dress!!! Good thing I have great friends who showed up the next day and helped me pick off hair, thread, and pieces of fabric!! But then we noticed!! They hadn't even completed the alterations!!! A pin was left in the corset of my dress no tread!! Just a Pin!! Like WTH!! I only wanted a corset added instead of a zipper, and a couple pick ups!! And they destroyed my dress!! Be careful!!!
I ate lunch here the other day and it was very good. Friendly and good service.  So much to choose from on the menu. I can't wait to go back and try more.

NEVER AGAIN!!
If you like to be served by Snobby women, who only chat you up when you are paying your bill then this is the place!!!

My Husband took my to dinner to Celebrate my new promotion at work, after we seated on the patio we began to wait.  She had 3 other tables on the patio, so not busy, but after 5 min with no menu, we also had no acknowledgement from the waitress, when another table for three walks in and she begins to serve them promptly!!! What a great celebration it was to wait another 10 min before she came over to drop off menus!!! she didn't even take our drink order!! then she rushed us on our food order, when she hadn't even brought our drinks!!!

There was nothing good about the service! Our steaks we so grease and dripping with excess oil, we wouldn't even give the leftovers to our dog! I hope the table of 3 she served before us, made up for the tip she didn't NOT receive from us!

I will never come here again!

BTW: your beer size in CC is really an 18OZ pint, but your charging as a 20OZ.  10% mark-up on a smaller drink.

Bucket of Bacon...Need I say more?? 

Ok, this place is really good; friendly service (pretty too), and the food was actually top shelf (their thin crust pizzas are legit and reasonably priced) and the place looked well maintained and comfortable. I think though it suffers from looking like every other pub that's out their, which is not necessarily a bad thing but it is what it is. I went during lunch on a Thursday and this place was deadville, so I had low expectations but was pleasantly surprised. Wonder what  it like in the evenings, during the playoffs?

If you find yourself in Airdrie and hungry, give it a try.
I'm a beer geek. The beer menu here is above average for a neighbourhood bar/chain, but there are no standout brews. The food is decent, but nothing standing out means this is just A-Ok.
Really great food and service. Not sure why I haven't been here sooner. The wings are nice and crispy, the nachos are gigantic! You can't go wrong with a bucket of candy bacon! Will become a regular.

I went there with my 3 year old and he had his hand slammed in the car door. I told them he needed an X-ray. I didn't think he broke it but I guessed a fracture. They made us wait 3 hours then when we saw the doctor, they told us they don't X-ray under 8 years old. They wanted us to wait 3 days and to see if it got worse. What a huge waste of our time.
I took my son to my doctor the next morning. They gave him an X-ray. I was right. He had a fracture. Thanks for nothing urgent care!!!!
Not bad for a drink or two if your with your friends. Nice service. Crowd can be bad. Security has no clue how to react to situations or speak to paying, well behaving patrons.

Terrible service. We came to load a shipment from the storage unit and were there 5 minutes from closing time. They say there and hovered over us until we left and treated us like we were pieces of crap. Not to mention the nasty office building there were children's cribs and play toys in the building as well as non washed counters and papers all over the floor.  Very unfriendly and non cooperative. WILL NOT RECOMMEND.

DO NOT use these guys for storage.

My first impression of the salon is that it's fresh and clean. There are these pretty glass dividers between the front of the salon where the manicure tables are and the back section where the spa pedicure chairs are. It's painted a light mossy green which is soothing. I really like the large chandelier in the front area and the funky chic silver filigree lights in the pedicure area.

I had booked an appointment for noon and I had to wait about 15 minutes for my turn. They were really busy on Saturday. The pedicure was ok. Then it was time for my manicure. 

The guy in the shop did my manicure and did a terrible job of it. He was filing my nails wildly and I ended up fixing some nails that were not looking good. Then after he painted my nails, I looked closely at them and noticed he missed parts here and there and I saw fibers from the cotton balls mixed in the polish. What a mess. So he removed all the polish and started over. But he made a mess again. The one girl came over to finish my manicure and I was pleased with what she did. 

Overall it was pretty good and I'll most likely return as long as I don't have the guy do my mani pedi.

Food is rough ! Even my kids passed on it . We went for the buffet breakfast . Still had to pay full price even though my 5 yr old only eat half a sausage and my other soon had nothing ! I filled up on the eggs as the rest looked like something I would feed a dog:( won't be back . Staff were friendly so that helps !

Un. Believable. We popped in here for brunch with some friends since there was a massive wait at a more popular breakfast place in the area. We had been here before to try the different craft beers, but had never experienced the food menu.

The decor is beautiful and whoever designed it has fabulous taste, but that is the extent of my positivity about this place.

I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich of sorts and what I got has turned me off chicken for the foreseeable future. The sandwich itself was bland, but being hungry I got through the first half kind of just deciding I would never order this particular item again if we came back. What I got with the first bite of my second half is what this review is about. 

I bit into the sandwich and got a mouthful of grizzle and fat so I popped open the sandwich after spitting my bite out and pulled out a huge chunk of fat. My Hubs (not being as picky as me) thought I was over exaggerating and went to eat it and what he got he had to spit out as well.

After sending it back, someone (I am assuming a shift manager, she didn't introduce herself) came out and asked what was wrong with it. I explained my complaint and she said the kitchen staff had examined the carnage and agreed it was sub par.  I told her I was shocked that any person with half a brain would send something of this poor quality out of the kitchen, let alone expect a paying guest to consume it. She offered me 50% off my sandwich as a gesture of their apology. I laughed a little (while just shaking my head) because I didn't feel like arguing about it, but what if I had taken that half to eat first? Unfortunately she affected our servers tip and I believe she owes our server the difference. 

So, I will "take" your 50% off the sandwich (a lousy apology, by the way, for my disturbing experience) and I will "see" you one review.

See you "never"!
This place was recommended by a friend. I highly recommend it to anyone else in the area. Fast service. Fair prices. And the quality/flavor of the food is top notch.

Was there last Saturday at about 11, sat down for 20 minutes with my girl and no serving staff came up to us at all. A few looked right at us as they walked by to the couple of occupied tables but other than that nothing. We left and went to another place in town but I am pretty concerned as we are a mixed race couple and were completely ignored. As we were leaving I noticed all the staff just hanging out at the bar with the bartender chit chatting. I don't think it's fair to say their behaviour was racist but completely without any class is probably accurate.

Very nice setting. The building is nice and modern and staff are helpful at times. However it gets super busy and I guess it's not their fault but they took 3 hours to get my dad in who was very critical. Once they got him they sent him to a semi private room. Overall a good urgent care Center

Love this place! My wife and I just moved to Airdrie from Calgary, and lets just say Zenbu was a contributing factor! I'm from Vancouver and I've had my fair share of sushi and sashimi and figured anything in Alberta couldn't possibly compare...I was wrong.  The sashimi is among the best I've had. We haven't had a bad roll yet, and we've made a few return trips to try more. The inside of the restaurant is quite nice.  I was quite surprised the first time we ate there. This is our sushi restaurant now, as it easily tops any of the sushi joints we've been to in Calgary!
love this place ! its great for breakfast or lunch , food comes super fast ... and has always been awesome !

Wow!

Very impressive new pub with a great beer selection, excellent food, a very nice (upscale) ambience, and incredible service from  a bevy of attractive and attentive servers. Think Earl's. I had the pizza and it was just excellent, a small pizza was too much for me, I took half of it home. They have some upscale beers that include free glasses to take home, wing nights (no take out), nice booths and lots of TV's. 

Pour has raised the bar for eateries and drinking establishments in Airdrie.
A nice place with a huge variety of beers.  Everyone can find a beer they like here!

The food here was not good.  
There were three of us for lunch, food was cold und under-cooked. Bucket of bacon was cold, and not crispy. Calamari was served cold, soggy, and under-cooked. Pizza, steak sandwich, and macaroni were ok, but all a little lack lustre. Although one doesn't exactly go to a pub for a cup of tea, this establishment doesn't have any tea at all.  Weird.

It's changed quite a bit since it was Dicks Pub. They have changed the menu, added a liqour store worth of beer, and made it a decent experience. Food is all ok, not the best in town, but I have only tried a few menu items. Tons of draft beer. I can't even guess at how many. Staff is pretty good at giving suggestions on what to try, so go out on a limb and try that new brew!

We went here on a Thursday night with a group of 6 people. The sales staff at this store are very lovely and knowledgeable. We got our own section with chairs and mirrors to watch the dress reveals.   The bride tried on a total of 10 dresses and the salesgirl helping us was very friendly and not pushy at all. I would definitely recommend this store. It was the positive experience I've had at a bridal store. They have a huge selection of wedding gowns, evening dresses, wedding veils and jewelry.

When we walked in our waitress greeted us in a rude manner just tossed the menus on the table. She was swearing every second word even calling he boss the c word. Very unprofessional the food was very below average for the price. Safe to say I will not be going back there.

Wow, really fresh and flavourful! Nice fusion of Korean and Japanese cuisine.

This is definitely going to become my go to stop after work. Really quick service, and friendly staff. The restaurant is very clean and the atmosphere is traditional Japanese decor but absolutely not overdone.

My daughter and I are both picky about the sushi; she loves this place hands down so we only go here when the craving for sushi hits. The food is just amazing and delicious. My daughter often orders two plates of california rolls; her fave. Rice is good and food is just right. Not over or under cooked at all. I love their good prices; not even overpriced at all. :) The waitress was very sweet and nice. Hubs asked for extra pickled ginger and got that.
Finally, a place to go in Airdrie that doesn't feel like a last resort when we don't want to drive into Calgary. Great food, great service, great ambiance! We will be back for sure.

We have been trying different pubs in the Airdrie area over the past 6 months and this place will certainly be removed from our list. Beer selection was average, food was below average and cocktail selection, despite having a large menu, was pitiful. Ordered an Old Fashioned and was given a glass of bourbon with a cherry and a sugar cube in it. There was even a picture of the drink in the menu as it should be presented. So a glass of bourbon (Bullet) and a sugar cube cost $14 - quite unbelievable.

So, obviously make your own decisions but we will never be going back.

Update: Tried this place a second time and was equally disappointed. 

We asked the waitress what she recommended we eat, since the Stromboli's we tried the first time were so bad. She recommended pizza, said it was a fan favourite but honestly, I don't see why. The three of us each tried a different pizza and it was mediocre at best. The food here is definitely 2 stars. 

In my first review I said their beer selection was amazing, and that I would definitely have drinks here again. Well, I take that back. EVERY beer I wanted to try was sold out, I'm talking 4-5 different beers! That's just poor management, I mean come on... the place is called The POUR!

I don't recommend this place AT ALL. Try somewhere else, don't waste your hard earned cash.

Go here if you have tons of time and want mediocre food.  8 mins wait at door before anyone cared to seat us. Only 5 tables already seated and served, took 25 mins to get 2 breakfast items.  Poached soft eggs mean dried out yolks.  Did not send back took too long first time ariund. No coffee refills, dont expect any service until its bill and tip time.  I have a tummy ache now.
Beautiful spa with awesome service and professional work. In love with my shelac nails! Definetley recommend this place for all your spa needs!
Good food. Great wait staff. Nice layout. Good drinks. However not everyone wants to watch UFC fights. 2 TV's playing crap comedy shows all the rest playing UFC. Hockey fans deserve a TV.

Arrived Friday March 10 around 8 pm was fairly busy got seated and forgotten.   Found menu selection not vegan friendly after waiting about 20 minutes no further contact from waitress for drinks although she did look at us but never got drinks served.   Mark this place for drinks only although happy hour value better across the street.

Furniture was destroyed. A hole in the roof from rust let water almost everything was wet or moldy. They refuse to take any responsibility for it.Going ao far as to say the hile never existed and we must have drilled it just to get money from then. The man insists on yelling and interrupting. 

UPDATE:
upon returning to the unit to pick up the last of our items the owner began recording us taking photo's of the damage. When asked why he was recording us he jumped in his car and said he now 'understood our intentions' My Brother confronted him asking for the $110 reimbursement he had said he would deliver. The owner then declared he was going to call the police, we invited him to and encouraged him to.  Instead the owner barricaded himself in his office, locking the doors and setting the alarm. Upon leaving the facility he wanted us to sign a no-slander agreement. We declined. We did not receive the reimbursement.
The food is pretty low quality, but you should expect that at a Smitty's. Nothing special about it.

Low quality for the price.  Usually good service though. 

Very disappointed in the kids meal omelette,  absolutely cannot believe that cost $6.  It was maybe a one egg omelette,  the size of our one year olds hand.  A serving size is two eggs,  can't they at least do a serving? 

The buffet leaves a lot to be desired.  Most items are dry,  though it is nice to have the fresh fruit bowl (when it's full).  Other Smitty's buffets are superior.

The food here was average. We had shrimp stir fry, won ton soup and spring rolls. Nothing special. I've had better in town. The portions are good though. The location is really handy... Right on Main Street by Safeway. 

The restaurant is not clean. The basket on the table holding the condiments and the chopsticks and, yes, even the forks was iffy. The soya sauce was empty and the top of the siracha sauce was caked with dry sauce. I'm not a clean freak by any means but felt the need to wash my chopsticks with a wet nap I had in my purse before using them. My shoes stuck to the floor as I walked to my table. When you leave you'll smell like deep fry.  

The service was slow but friendly enough. There were three other tables eating when I was there. All three tables had to go to the front to find the waitress to get to-go boxes. Food came from the kitchen pretty quickly. 

I wouldn't go back here. But I said that last time I was there ...  :) If I'm in the area and cave ever again, it will definitely be take out.

Wanted to grab a quick bite before the matinee at Crossiron Mills, this was just the ticket on a Friday afternoon day off. The place was virtually empty except for one other table so we grabbed a table by the garage door windows, awesome when the weather is fine and the windows are rolled up, as close to patio as you get.

Beer selection is good and the food was too.

So nice to get another local pub in Airdrie that serves some decent pub grub.

Very pleasing selection of microbrews. Only complaint is that the front of the place makes it look like they're closed. No lights and they have some things leaned up against the inside, front windows.

I visited the Airdrie Urgent Care Clinic on Sunday, June 4th 2017 at approximately 7pm. The reason for my visit was that I had been experiencing unusual cold-like symptoms that were severe and prolonged. 

When I arrived I was prompted by a sign near triage stating that I had to stop behind a red line and wait until a triage nurse could see me. My fiancé and I stood there for 20 minutes, all the while, two nurses and an administrative worker stood at a desk chatting a meter away from us. For those 20 minutes we listened to them complain about patients, co-workers and their personal lives without any kind of acknowledgement that we were even stood there. Meanwhile, a line behind us started to form which included elderly people and families with young children. When they finally finished their conversations a nurse called me over to her desk to promptly tell me that it was a 4 hour wait, I said that it was no problem as I was in a considerable amount of pain. She checked my vitals, filled a chart and had me register with the administrative staff. 

I proceeded to wait three and a half hours until I was called up (which is not my concern, we live in a large city with many surrounding communities and wait times add up), when I was called it was a new nurse who quickly tried to usher me into another area to be looked at by a doctor and when I could not keep up, she barked at me saying, "that chair in the back, go sit there" and did not acknowledge me further. 

After another 20 minutes a young doctor came to see me, he asked about my history, checked my ears, throat, glands and head. Told me it was a common cold, to drink plenty of fluids and take some advil. He also mentioned that he noticed that I had been swabbed for strep throat two months prior and that he felt he didn't need to test again for it because of this and sent me home. 

Today, Monday, June 5th 2017 I decided to see another doctor for a second opinion. He did all the same tests and immediately prescribed me an antibiotic to treat my symptoms, which turns out was strep throat as well as an ear infection. 

I am thoroughly disappointed with the treatment I received at Airdrie urgent care, I understand that being a health services professional is a difficult job that requires a lot from a person, but I was not treated with any decency or respect from any of the staff working on this occasion. For patients to wait hours on end to see a doctor, only to receive less than 5 minutes of a doctors time and be sent home with no answers is a shame. I would recommend that AHS not only trains their staff to better treat and respect their patients, but also how to behave in the workplace in general. Lunchroom gossip needs to be saved for the lunchroom, not the front desk where 20+ people can hear you and are waiting to be served. In addition, I would recommend that for patients (who are usually in pain/miserable/exhausted as is from whatever is ailing them) be treated with some kind of courtesy or kindness from AHS staff in order to provide a positive experience for both parties. I saw several young families come through those doors with injured and sick little ones who were treated the exact same way I was, and the waiting room was filled with chatter of how disappointing the treatment from staff was. Lastly, Doctors need to be able to either have more time or more patience in order to better diagnose and recommend treatment for their patients; having two visit two doctors offices in a 24 hour period is not enjoyable and much of my ordeal could have been avoided if the doctor who saw me at Airdrie Urgent Care had actually taken the time to do his job properly.

Zenbu is almost always great. I don't like their California roll recipe, but the Beebeem Bap, Bulgogi, Bento Boxes, Ton Catsu, and rolls are always great. 

Fish is usually tasty.

We ate here with friends tonight and I have to say I was a little apprehensive as our 22 year old whose birthday celebration this was is a very picky eater. 

Everything we ordered was excellent from the sushi and gyoza to the teriyaki chicken and udon beef.

The staff were very attentive and the food arrived quickly and sizzling on skillets. Will definitely be returning.

The pho was great the soup was made in house which is also good.  We have eaten at alot of Vietnamese places over the years (being from Vancouver) and the one meets the criteria.

The balance of spices in the broth were good and the color and taste was good.  I did find the broth to be a bit salty and it had a fairly steady taste of black pepper.

That being said each place you go to will have their own soup broth flavor so it really all comes down to preference when it comes to spice preferences.

I would certainly come back.

We had high hopes for this place since it rated higher than other bars in Airdrie but we were disappointed by the food. 
My pizza was bland and they didn't bring the parmesan cheese shaker I'd asked for. Service was good and prompt for the most part although they did forget one of the meals - everyone had finished their meal by the time we thought we should check on it and eventually it did arrive. 
A friend commented on a strange taste from all the beers on tap that he'd tried and whilst the food wasn't awful none of us spoke highly of our meals and we'd probably choose to return to other bars in the area before coming back here. 
Points for the decor though - the chandeliers were very pretty albeit seemed a little out of place.

I had the worst experience at the Mezzanine Hair in Airdrie. I went there twice for  highlight color treatment, and first time even though it was a correction it was good. I liked the color. After 6 weeks I went back to get a new color, to cover my roots and get lighter highlights. Alyssa, the same hair stylist was getting behind, actually had to leave me there waiting as she went to do a haircut for another client, and that's how it was almost 4 hours, her jumping between other people fixing their cuts or color. It was close to closing hour and one lady she was working on, was still sitting under the dryer with the color correction on. She run out of time to trim my hair so she hacked it here and there. I went home and the hair just would not line up in layers, the rough hacking was just there on both sides of my head different length. Never mind the color, greenish gray, mousy color. 
Went back to the salon and talked to the owner, right away she was defensive, told me to "work with her ", as far as appointment time for fixing it, and she said she would try to "squize me in" on Saturday. Told her I have already been "squizzed" and told her how the stylist was jumping from client to client when she was doing my color. We agreed on Saturday appt. I went there, she wanted to hot iron my hair first, I said I would preffer no to  hot iron. Then she started dry cut my hair, and finally suggested I go somewhere else, she would give me my money back. I said it was a good idea. 
She however gave me back just the money for the haircut and refused the color money. As I demended the full refund, she thretened me with the police, grabbing the phone. I left upset and disappointed, and disilussioned about the quality of service some salons provide.
Beware, if you go there, and it happens you don't like the service and demand the money back, they will call the police on you.

After 5 years my spa blew a breaker Friday morning and is out of service.  Adam came out that afternoon did his diagnostics and was confident it was pump #1. 
Check pump specs and by 6 pm that same evening new pump and my spa is back working.
Big thanks Adam and crew.

My daughter went in to get her nails done for grad, was happy with them when she left the salon. After only 4 days they started lifting and chipping off around the edges. She went back to have them fix the nails and was told that it was just because they were growing out. 4 DAYS!! I think not. they would not honour their work and I am very very unhappy as she now has to go to a different salon to have her nails fixed, what should have been a $60.00 job is now going to cost twice that!! horrible

The stylists don't understand how to listen to what the customer wants. If I say "cut 3 inches off" I expect you to do just that. Not hack off an extra 3" because you feel like it. Never will they have my business again. I'd rather cut my own hair than pay someone who obviously isn't qualified to do so. 
Disappointed that I have to try to grow my hair back out. AGAIN. See you never.

Great food, good atmosphere, great price for all you can eat sushi on Wednesday's. friendly staff. Excellent service. Food is freshly made. Quite of assortment of sushi and dishes. 
The presentation of the food is great too. 
Would highly recommend this restaurant.

Everyone please if you care for your dog you will not take them here. They need to be put out of business. Sure they shaved my dog when I told them not to but the issue is much greater than this. I picked up my dog to find large cuts and scabs on her belly, legs, and private parts. The infection got so bad that I had to take her to emergency that night. Maybe these things can happen while at a groomer but what happened next is unreal. When I called them the next day the owner told me that any dog that puts up a struggle deserves to be cut, to get over it because my dog won't die from it and that she doesn't care if she lost me as a customer because she has hundreds more. She also told me that if my dog is suffering I deserve it because I let her get knots in her fur and therefore I am abusing my dog and the only reason I am complaining is to find an excuse for someone to pay my vet bills. 
 People please, I am not looking for a refund and I can pay my vet bills. I can not have this happen to another dog. 
 DO NOT LET THIS DEVIL TOUCH YOUR DOG. It's a week later and my dog still can not stand or walk and she has the nerve to yell at me over the phone and blame me for everything. It's the saddest thing, don't let it happen to you as well.

I took my 3 pound 12 year old yorkie here and they accidentally nipped not one but both of his dewclaws on his back legs resulting in him needing to be put under and have surgery. They handled the situation terribly; blaming my dog for the mishap and not wanting to pay the bill. They ended up paying for half of the bill (how kind) and offered his next grooming free.. no thank you. Save your dog the pain and steer clear would be my advice

Just went for the first time yesterday. Went at 1pm on a Wednesday and the place was dead( I love shift work) 

Beer was great, had a schooner. Most of the beers on tap I have tried before but I will return to try some more. Also had a BLT and fries. Great food was the opinion  from my group.
Good food, friendly family business.  Pho is really yummy, as are most things on the menu.  Good for a quick meal with the family and take out.

I was a bit disappointed the last time I had dinner with friends here.  In the past the food was amazing.  But this time, it seemed to be lacking.  The service was also very slow.  Not as good as it used to be.
Great bar, typical noise, great brisket, give it a try I think you will like it, I did

Sorso Coffee is a newer coffee shop in Airdrie, and I really enjoyed my breakfast here! The vibe is great, and I'm always for a coffee shop that turns into a bar in the evenings. It seems like a quality, quiet coffee shop that is a great place to hang. 

For food, I got one of their turkey/egg sandwich on an English muffin. It was a good size and very tasty. It came with a little garnish of orange, which was a nice touch. I wouldn't have minded if it were a little larger, but the taste was spot on. 

For coffee, I ordered a French press (perfect for a group). It made about 4 cups, which was great for our group. Not only was it practical, but the coffee was great too!

Since I haven't spent much time in Airdrie, I'm not sure if there are many other coffee shops around. Sorso seems to be top notch though, so if you're passing through and wondering if it's worth a stop, I'd say give it a shot!

Tony's is pretty good and it's a good amount of food for a good price but it's not my favorite Vietnamese in Airdrie, and it's one of my last places to order from. I find I prefer a clean clear flavour in my broth and when I had theirs it was a bit murky and had a bit too much salt and a bit too much star anise. If that's your deal, then this place is for you! (saying this with no sarcasm, I know people who prefer this type over the place I favour). I did have an issue with takeout once where they forgot my entire meal and then tried to compensate me by giving me 3 free spring rolls but still making me pay for my meal and extra delivery fee.

Amazing. My Mom is allergic to canola and eggs and I'm allergic to gluten. The chef came out suggested dishes and worked with us to come up with yummy food. And did you catch that? YUMMY!!! The best Vietnamese food I have ever had!! And four of us were stuffed full for under $40. Go eat awesome food there!
Hands down the best authentic Mexican in Alberta. My favourite is the enchilada verde.
Coffee tastes amazing. I had the local honey latte and it was perfect. Tried the lavender honey macrons and they are delicious. Ambiance is nice and cozy especially on a rainy cold day.
Love their beef/chicken subs and bubble tea :) They have a huge selection of Vietnamese and Chinese food. The Pho is good too!

My wife and I usually order from here because it's quite close to home. We have not yet eaten in, but whenever we order take out the food is ready fairly quickly. The vermicelli dishes are quite good, better than the other Vietnamese restaurant nearby. Salad rolls are a staple of ours too, and we are never disappointed.

Came here with my mother in law for tea and breakfast! Absolutely the best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had! I had the "candy-bacon mac daddy"  better then I could have ever imagined!! Their "tamayo" sauce is super good as well!

As someone with a peanut allergy, I had never actually tried Vietnamese food before coming to Tony's. Fortunately for me, the staff here is very accommodating of allergies despite the prevalence of peanuts on the menu. This was a great introduction to Vietnamese food for me. I have so far tried three of their vermicelli noodle bowls: the pork, the beef sate, and the Super Combo, which includes beef, chicken, spring rolls, and shrimp. All of these have been absolutely delicious. The meat is fantastic, the veggies are fresh, crunchy, and flavourful, and the spring rolls are some of the best I've ever had. The sheer amount of food that you get for the price is fantastic; the noodle bowls cost between $9.50 and $10.50, and can easily be two meals worth of food. Be sure to try their Vietnamese iced coffee as well! 
While the table service can be a little lacking at times, the staff are all very friendly, and the food comes out just minutes after ordering. 
This is a great new restaurant for Airdrie, so be sure to check it out.
Best smoked meat I have ever eaten hands down!! Brisket and brisket tacos were so yummy  Best food I have eaten in a long long time very friendly staff

Services & food was outstanding! We had the lemon veal meat was so perfectly cooked and flavour that made your mouth water, side was the penne in a zesty fresh tomato sauce it was perfectly cooked. Our other dish was spaghetti carbonara was PERFECT not over powered by bacon because they do not use bacon it was either pancetta or prosciutto they way it should be made! The homemade the dressing caesar salad is homemade with fresh crisp romaine lettuce & bread crumbs 

The passion of authentic Italian food is very notable in the cooking & worth the drive to Airdrie

I used Yelp to find a decent place for lunch for us when passing through airdrie. 

I asked if their food has MSG - the woman checked with the kitchen.  She said "everything has MSG, sorry" I was like, everything? not one single thing is free of MSG? "yep". 

So I ordered nothing while my husband ordered something as he is much less sensitive than I am. 

She came back to say that they could make spring rolls without MSG but that would be the only item they could make without MSG.  

I ordered that, but was super disappointed and it was not that great, especially as their hoisin sauce for dipping was sickeningly sweet, and my husband thought so too.

Service was nice, cannot say anything bad about that.   But very disappointed about the MSG in everything except literally one single boring appetizer item.  

Will not go back.

This is the king of all Walmarts in the region. The Airdrie Walmart Supercentre has everything and at good prices.

It's not as great as the American ones where you can buy liquor and guns and groceries and anything you want, but it's our best hope. They do offer groceries at this location and anything else you can imagine a department store selling. They even have products you can't find in the more urban Walmarts.

It's worth a trip to if you need everything....
Absolutely amazing, walked in to get something hanging from my car looked at and they fixed it for me for no charge. And we're great with my dog. Thanks again !

I was very surprised to read the review below. I go to Sorso daily because the coffee is the best in the city and does Tim Horton's even know what an americano is? The atmosphere is very warm and welcoming and the staff is extremely friendly. It's super funky in there and I appreciate that it's not a typical coffee shop. We actually specifically went for the cheese scones, which are delicious!!! And I personally love that it is a family friendly coffee shop with toys and a kids corner to keep the little ones occupied while their parents enjoy a delicious drink and snack! Two big thumbs up!

Not a great take out experience. Our delivery guy showed up very late, I had to call and make sure it was still coming. The soup was bland as was the  vermicelli and the meat in all meals was mostly pieces of fat. Fortunately all three meals ordered where edible however not very good. I won't be ordering from them again.

I cannot tell you how much I LOVE these guys. Seriously. I have been coming to OK Tire in Airdrie as long as I can remember. They were recommended to me by W&B Automotive, when I bought my very first car and I needed Winter Tires. Don was extremely accommodating. Every time I have a flat and need a tire repair, they've always gotten me in right away and gotten it fixed immediately. Sometimes at no-charge even! 

My most recent experience was today. On Saturday I got a flat tire in Madden, AB and had to get AMA to come change my tire. I tried to get into Canadian Tire to have them fix it, and they told me the hole was "Too big for the plug" and that I needed to buy a new tire. And they were going to charge me a fortune for it because I have 17" low-profile tires. 

I took it in to Don this morning and he had a look at it and was able to fix it. 

I ALWAYS recommend OK tire to my friends and colleagues when they ask me where a good place to buy tires is. Even if they live in Calgary, the quality of service is well worth it.

Visited IL FORNO on November 30/13 and was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and service.  My wife and I had the veal special that is on the daily menu which was superb.  The two grand children had the thin crust pizza that appeared to be good.  The other couple had lasagne and a pasta dish which they greatly enjoyed.

We had calamari and bruschetta with a delicious cheese ball for appetizers that were excellent.

For desert we shared two generous portions of tiramisu which concluded the very enjoyable meal.

I do highly recommend this restaurant and will definitely return.

I am sick and so I wanted some chicken noodle soup but with the weather being sub -20c out, I opted for the extra money for delivery and tip. (delivery is free over $25, don't forget the tip LOL) (having a sick stomach  may affect my review.)
Great price, and the spring rolls were good. I wasn't completely satisfied with the taste of the chicken noodle soup, but the portion was large. 
That is all I can say from this one experience.

Really just tried this place as its close to my house. 

At work I loved Vietnamese food near sunridge! 
Well here is just as good so glad I tried it! 

Had beef vermicelli with spring rolls. Delicious just wish I'd been offered the Hoisin sauce to take out like I would of in Calgary. Next time I will ask.

It was fast hot and regular price can't wait to go again. The place was clean and service was good
Definitely not the same since the switch from the last owner. Threw most of my order away

Not impressed. Ordered food for pick up.lady on the the phone says half an hour so we got there on time..food was cold and super dry. We ordered pastor tacos,chuleta, chorizo, quesdillas with queso and enchiladas.paid $44 for a garbage food.
Great food, value, and great service! I come here at least once a week and I am never disappointed.

Love to come eat here. We are from further away and every time we come this way we make sure to eat here. Very authentic and tasty. You definitely need to give it a try!  The outside does look rough but as soon as you walk in it has great atmosphere, music, and the staff is excellent!!  The chilaquiles are my favorite and the tacos de carnitas!
Talk about a diamond in the rough! Fabulous food, great staff. My new favourite restaurant in Airdrie.

Im a project manager for a pipeline company and have personnalh used / sent my team for rental vehicles to enterprise for years. This location is, by far, the worse enterprise I have dealt with in nearly 10 years.
Delicious! Great menu. Everything tastes as good Pho should.

We visited this little gem of a restaurant and highly recommend you to check it out! The food is amazing and very reasonably priced. I enjoyed the Enchiladas verde and it was very authentic. We also ordered the Flautas and they were very good as well. The guacamole was super creamy and amazing! We greatly enjoyed our meal here. The restaurant was clean and very pleasant and the service was wonderful. You've got to eat here!!
Worst place ever Don't go here unless you want the rudest services and FOOD POISONING

The worst Vietnamese food I have ever had and it's way over priced.  They charge $17 for garlic shrimp with steamed rice.  The shrimp were tiny and the rice looked like it's been sitting out all day and then heated up.  The vermicelli barely any veggies and the flavour tasted stale.  Would not recommend this place to anyone.

I had been wanting some good BBQ for a while. When this place opened, I had to try it. We both had the Brisket, and I would have no problem recommending it. The meat was flavourful and juicy with a nice smoke ring. It was so tender you could cut it with a spoon.

This place is amazing. I always see the same guys every time (Cam), but the other guys are also excellent.  I know about 20 guys who swear by this place.  I won't go anywhere else in Airdrie now that I found this place.

I had the veggie wonton and my boyfriend had his usually pork/spring roll vermicelli bowl. I have to say that it was probably the best wonton soup that I ever had!!  Broth was not bland at all and the wontons themselves had amazing flavour!! The only reason that I didn't give a 5 was that the atmosphere wasn't too great in the restaurant itself and there was a bit of a musty smell.

Food was great though and I can definitely see us getting takeout in the future and making this our Airdrie Vietnamese go-to place :)

I'm copying the opening suggestion for review because it is exactly how I feel about this place!!
Very rarely do I find a place where food is created so expertly and most of the decor is hand made, and 1/2 of the bar is an old farm find!!
My first bite into my BCLT Mack daddies was heavenly so much flavour on a small English muffin, and it was enough of a breakfast with a side of honey granola yogurt to fill me! My husband had the classic breakfast, hash browns flavoured perfectly, bacon glazed with honey so lightly that it's not overly sweet, sausage was excellent!! Mocha latte was my husbands favourite coffee! 

What can I say about the decor and ambiance?? I love it, hand made wood tables and lighting! A little smaller and sometimes 45 min wait times, but owner is very personable and welcoming! They have drive through if you are in a hurry and take out too! All in all this is the best place Ove eaten for breakfast! Gonna try dinner soon and they support local charities and have charitable events once a month!
Come see for yourself!!

Dank dank tacos for a reasonable amount of your hard earned shekels. This place is DOPE! Recommend the carnitas, I just can't stop eating them. Can't say I have had anything bad off of the menu yet. This is real Mexican food folks, get here before the wall!

Fast Food Asian. And Indian!
Friendly staff and one of the better tasting Wok Box food experiences we have had.
Clean store, ample seating, large space.
I had the Dan Dan Noodles and it supposed to be the spiciest - I guess by Western standards it may be but I had to add sriracha sauce. I got it with ribbon noodles and shrimp and it was good!
He got the Kung Pao with chow mein noodles and he liked it!
Still, with no drinks ordered, $23 total. Pricey but would return when we just did not have the time for a real sit down meal at a restaurant.

Crazy good! Where do I start? 

The girls and I went for supper on a slow, rainy night and found our new favourite restaurant in Airdrie! We knew they moved from Main Street to an obscure part of town and it is a little hard to find if your aren't looking or know where you are going, so Google it.

Service: paced nicely and they know what they are doing. From drinks, appies, entrées, coffee and dessert. Just when you start to look around, they are there. Impeccable, kind, friendly and knowledgable.

Food: Insane! Just look at my photos! A couple of girls got the daily special and loved it. I asked for a recommendation and there was no hesitation with the suggestion. Also, limincello and the tiramisu- just go for it! No regrets. 

Location: A little out of the way with restaurant access a wee bit limited. They are located on the second floor and there are stairs or an elevator which feels a little unsafe. (Imagine an unenclosed elevator unit- only 3 'walls' where you can literally reach out and touch the drywall while going up/ down.)

Again, the service and food are amazing! Reservations are recommended on weekend/ holidays. Go here for a Date Night and enjoy the experience, leave the kids at home.

Note: They have both lunch and supper hours.

Don't judge from the outside. This is one of the most authentic Mexican restaurants in the Calgary area. The waitress was so nice, the food comes fast and was so delicious. If your looking for good Mexican food I definitely recommend this place. I have nothing bad to say except the outside does look a little iffy but it's totally worth it!
One of the best place I've eaten in Airdrie so far, authentic home cooked yumminess! I'll always be stopping by for a quick bite!
Wonderful service and good vibes the whole time. Food was flavorful and well priced. Great selection of drinks including many Mexican beers.

Just a quick update: Sorso has gotten even better. I lasted reviewed them during the first week that they had opened. They were still working out the kinks! The decor is even better since I was last there. A bit of a hipster, industrial and rustic vibe to it.

I got to taste their food when I went last, and got tomato soup with grilled cheese. Damn it was good. The tomato soup was authentic, and reminded me of pasta sauce (in the "fresh-tomato" kind of way) and the grilled cheese was made on a panini press, so the crust was crunchy and delicious. I'll always go back as often as I can. Truly a unique and local gem in Airdrie.

Wow, there's a vast array of reviews for this coffee shop! I had a great experience. I was heading back to Edmonton from Calgary and wanted a good latte.  The decor is great, there is plenty of seating, and the staff were friendly enough. The latte was made perfectly, and I even enjoyed one of the treats.  I don't know what some people are expecting when they come here, but I got exactly what I expected! Happy customer!

I have gone a few times with my uncle. Each time I tried something different and I've never been disappointed. 
I've always enjoyed the food and service.

I wanted to love this place I really did.  The assortment of items on their menu had my mouth watering as I read over the menu online.  I'd heard chatterings about Wok Box and when I finally looked it up I noted locations only in the South or Airdrie (I completely somehow missed the Kincora location in the North).  

Hubs was out of town one night for a boys night away.  I didn't want to cook so I took the kids out to eat.  Without too much arm twisting or wrestling, I talked them into trying out Wok Box in Airdrie as it's really not that far of a drive once you hop on the Deerfoot.  We must have arrived pre-dinner rush as we were the only ones in the place for the first 10 minutes or so.  We decided on 4 dishes total to share, kung pao chicken with chow mein noodles, chicken pad thai with ribbon noodles and 2 kids dishes....jungle chow mein noodles with veggies and breaded crispy chicken on rice.  I asked how big the non kid dishes were and I was told the size of the large take out box.  Seemed fine at the time and leftovers would be welcomed.

The portions came up at the pick up area and 2 of them were larger than life.  We ended up with a ton of food...so no complaints there.  Unfortunately it became quite obvious the chicken had been precooked and been sitting for awhile since even tossed in with the kung pao & pad thai dishes it was dry and lacked seasoning & flavour.  The chow mein noodles had also been precooked and did not taste like any chow mein noodle I've ever had before.  The flavours of these 2 dishes were just OK.  The kids jungle chow mein noodles were supposed to come with veggies but we only found a few veggies (cut up bok choy or celery) on the bottom of the bowl.  The rice was not fluffy but sticky as though it was not cooked properly.  The breaded crispy chicken was the best tasting of the meal.  My daughter asked for a order of Naan bread so we also got some.  Sadly it was a very small portion compared to the cost.  I let the kids enjoy it and did not get to taste it since there really wasn't enough for 3 of us.

The prices were fair overall, the place very clean and the employees friendly.   I still want to love this place and may give a different location another go in the future.

If you're looking for authentic Mexican food this is the place for you.  From the outside it looks a little rough, and you could forgive someone for passing by based on the "neighbourhood" but as a regular visitor to Mexico this is just part of the Authenticity.  The prices are incredibly reasonable, in fact when the bill came we double checked because we figured they must have missed something.  The food..... the food is incredible and like I said as Authentic as it gets.  I am lucky enough to live in Airdrie but would say this place is worth the drive from surrounding areas if you want the real deal.
Amazing, authentic, superb service! We came here with our family of 5 for lunch and were blown away. We live in Calgary but this is our new Mexican restaurant!!!!

NEVER GO TO MR. LUBE IN AIRDRIE !!!!

Mr.Lube in Airdrie Walmart charged me $40 plus tax for a simple tire repair. Upon asking why so expensive then Canadian Tire which is (26 plus tax).Lady mentioned oh we do plug n patch on tire Canadian tire only does plugs no patching... i called Canadian tire they explained we do plug n patch. I have no problem paying the cost, but when someone lies and make me a fool to sell their product.. thats when i usually lose my mind :)
Mr. Lube  Never Never again..

FINALLY Airdrie gets a decent bbq place... 2 months after I move to Edmonton lol. 
I've managed to make it for lunch  twice and both times it was awesome. The Mac and cheese is a little to reminiscent of nacho cheese for me but otherwise everything else I've had is excellent. The brisket is very good and I'm in love with their espresso BBQ sauce. Their green beans are phenomenal and for a little kick throw some BBQ sauce on them! Yum.

I took my dog to this vet after she broke off one of her Canine teeth. They were able to get her in right away for an appointment and the subsequent surgery was handled within the week. They provided us with the necessary pain killers to tied her over till the surgery and then with enough to make her comfortable post surgery and included a free of charge follow up a week after the surgery. The cost was very reasonable and the care she received was really exceptionable. I will be going back to this vet clinic for all my upcoming vet appointments.
Excellent atmosphere,  food is delicious (not from froozen) and drinks (non alcoholic) are yummy.

Amazing pho! Great food, massive portions, very low prices!!!

My personal favourite is #18. Broth has so much flavour and meat is so tender. Only thing I wish is that they had jalapeños to drop in the pho.
Just found my favourite coffee shop in Airdrie!  Love the beans from Rosso.  Goodbye Starbucks....

Have been dragged here twice by friends.....and was DELIGHTED!  The proprietor is a friendly fellow.  The food is as good as - or BETTER - than any I ever had in my extensive travels through Italy.  I don't say that lightly.  The location and decor are....welll.....unusual to say the least - but the food!  OMG!  I can't say enough good about this place.  The prices are great too!  If you dine here and feel that you should gripe about the prices....then you are probably more of a McDonald's "fine diner".  The serving staff is all absolutely excellent and they are all very attentive.  I won't hesitate to be a regular here......and I happily drive past many Italian restaurants in Calgary to get to this place.
Great service and food.  Very authentic!  Service was fast.  We asked to take our food out.  It was no problem.  We will definitely go again

This is the best food I've had in 5 years, never mind the best Italian food I've ever had. The staff is very personal and friendly, and the owner of the restaurant is the main waiter. It was absolutely perfect. Can't recommend enough!
Absolutely amazing , best Mexican I've had north of Mexico!!  Hard working, friendly and authentic. Can't wait to go back. May have to go bi-weekly.

These guys are great! After helping me find an excellent winter tire that checked all the boxes I booked an appointment to have them installed. While the tires were being installed I went restaurant next door for a coffee. Imagine my surprise when the service guy walked into the restaurant just to let me know my car was ready. You sure don't find customer service like that anymore. I am impressed.

Excellent deep dish pizza 
Fast and efficient delivery 
Every time I order I have leftovers because it is so thick great sauce lots of meat cheese toppings yummy

Growing up our family pets came here and now that I am in the area this is about the only place I will take my pets. They are always incredibly helpful and understanding when it comes to my dogs health. Vets very good at explaining all of the different options available and helping to make the right decisions. Would definitely recommend their services to anyone who needs a vet.
Food is excellent and restaurant was very quaint. We were there with another couple and were there for a late dinner. Everything was perfect except the crying toddler.

I read a few reviews about this place before, and they were mixed, let me shed some light. I lived in Houston TX for nearly 3 years, and being a Latino myself I was a frequent patron on all nearby Mexican restaurants. The food is simply great. It has that home made flavour that you cannot find on Taco Bell, or even on that fashionista mexican restaurant in downtown. Food is fresh, tasty, and the cook and owner are Mexican... so they know their stuff. In another review I read a guy complaining about the red sauce. Well, this is not your typical Mexican red sauce from Old El Paso, this is a Chile de Arbol Salsa, honestly, I've never tried it before and it was shocking when I tasted it, as I was expecting the regular bland red salsa. But once I learned it was a different salsa, I gave it a second try and I loved it. It has an aged, strong flavour that will make you think of tequila or vodka. Better if you have it with the food, as will be very dominant with tortillas alone. My partner ordered Tacos Dorados (chicken) and she was in love with them (and she is very hard to impress). I ordered Tacos de Costilla (beef) and although the presentation wasn't great, I'm still craving them the day after. Yes, the portions are a bit small, yes, there are kids jumping around, yes, the presentation is not very elaborated, but what the heck... it doesn't get more authentic mexican than this. Even if you go to mexico every 2 months, don't think that the food they serve over there is authentic.... is just tourist approved. Tacos Puerto Vallarta is probably the best authentic mexican food I've tasted in the last 10 years.

Went in with a friend quite soon after they opened. Loved the hipster vibe they had going with the decor.

I only ordered a drink, a London Fog, and it was good. I finished it quickly. I liked the atmosphere and how you didn't feel rushed to get out the door. It was fairly busy but service was quick. 

Bathrooms were very clean, and the Dad's Cereal was a cute touch.

Unfortunately I didn't get to taste any food since they didn't really have a menu at the time (or at lead it wasn't displayed anywhere that I noticed). I'd like to comeback and try some of the delicious looking dishes they post on Facebook/Instagram.
The food is mediocre. I've been to a bunch of Wok Box's and I'm never disappointed with the atmosphere but always with the price. This place is so expensive for what you get!

Heard good things about this restaurant, decided Cinco De Mayo was a great day to try it. Had to wait for a table, for drinks, and service, and even ordered our meal once, and then they got confused and needed to order it again after they misplaced our order. 2 wait staff on a busy day is not enough. However, the food more than made up for it, great taste, great drinks, have to say it was worth the wait and we will be returning customers. Just not on a major Mexican holiday.

Two of us when for early lunch and ordered coffee and burritos.  The coffee was so week you could see the bottom of the cup. Dishwater.  The burritos were half cooked. All the beans (and there was a lot lot of them) were all at one end and cold in sections. No sure how you do that. They did offer a 10 per cent off on our next visit. We asked why we would want that  because we weren't going back and we didn't eat the food we had. Small tin chairs and tables. Just a cold setting and small menu.

I live very close to Sorso and love swinging by there for a quick coffee. Their food is delicious and they put a lot of care and attention into their menu.
I enjoy the staff, and the atmosphere.
I love this place. In my opinion it's the best Vietnamese in town. Very fresh and top quality ingredients.
