I am torn with my review of this establishment. My Hubs and I love to support local businesses and this is very local for us and we really, really wanted to like it. The hard working owners and staff are wonderful and the restaurant is very clean, but... 

We didn't like the food. I have eaten at a lot of Vietnamese restaurants and this one did nothing for me. 

We shared the spring rolls, I had the bun thit nuong (rice vermicelli bowl) and my Hubs had a sub. The spring rolls were boring, my noodle bowl was bland and the sub had very few toppings. Note: They are not licensed. 

If this were a chain restaurant I would have given it 2 stars, seeing how it is independently owned, gets another star in my books.

I used to come here all the time when it was Standard Tap, I am extremely disappointed in the lack of service and diluted bbq sauce full of vinegar.
I will never come back.

I've tried their soups and vermicelli dishes, both dining in the restaurant and (more frequently) take out. It's good quality and inexpensive, perfect for my "I'm not going to cook tonight" moods. 

Evening staff are very friendly and great with kids.

My wife and I dropped in last night. Even though we didn't have reservations (which is highly recommended) they got us a table pretty quickly. The service was excellent, and our waitress was very kind and pleasant. We ordered the Rigatoni and the Tortellini and they were both absolutely amazing! We had a Canolli for dessert and while the cookie was a bit hard, the filling was the best we've ever had. We will definitely be back

Four of us enjoyed Main Street last night for the first time - Airdrie has been missing a place like this.  Folks are going to say that this restaurant is just Standard Tap rebooted, but more than just a bar this place has quite a good menu and was getting busy when we arrived just before 7pm on Friday.

As a BBQ joint barometer we always start with the fried pickles - they were great but it happens we prefer them in chip rather then spear form - no big problem here.

In typical real BBQ fashion, the smoked meats, including brisket, pulled pork, turkey or pork ribs are served in 1/2 pound portions around the $10 range.  You can also get a half chicken or "hot links" sausage (Kielbassa).   I liked the links but found the smoked casings a bit hard to cut - if you like the sausage 'snap', you'll love these.  They happened to be out of chicken but it's ok we'll get some next time.

Sides are extra but reasonable and include the usual coleslaw and beans but more spectacular the homemade mac and cheese and sweet smoked corn - these were beautiful.

Our ordering approach (since we didn't see a sampler) was to order several meats and sides and just shared - between 4 adults this worked out great, we came away stuffed and bill (food only) came to under $70 which seemed pretty reasonable.

The good folks from Half Hitch brewery in Cochrane were trolling around giving out samples of their Farmers Daugher Pale Ale which went nicely with the BBQ...

Decore/ambiance fit the venue with lots of TV including 2 monster screens.  Staff were friendly, relaxed and in good humour, joking with our table - the assistant manager brought us into the kitchen for a quick look at their smokers, already full of the next days goodness.

Well done Main Street, best of luck...will be looking forward to our next visit...

Cheers

Food was decent but the wait was disappointing. We came for lunch on a Sunday. It wasn't busy at all, maybe about 3-4 other tables occupied. Took about an hour for our 2x Mac Daddy sandwiches and a kiddo Hot Dog to arrive, and more waiting when we asked for popcorn. I thought Mac Daddy was supposed to be served with English muffins but ours was with one slice of rye toast cut in half. Would have been nice if we were informed ahead of time rather than finding out when we were paying and asking if the Mac Daddy is usually served with rye bread. Wasn't planning on having a 2-hour lunch here. I think we would have been in and out within the hour if the food arrived sooner. Not coming back anytime soon, if at all.
It was fantastic and inexpensive.  Very authentic and friendly staff. My wife and kids also loved it. The favors were exactly like the food we had in Puerto Vallarta.

Came here for Valentine's day. Our server was so nice she insisted we sample the beer before committing to a glass. We ordered the chopped brisket sandwich and  tipsy Texan sandwich and spicy fries. We also had the rib ends for an appetizer.  Rib ends were great. The brisket was amazing but the tipsy Texan was a work of art. 10/10 would eat again.
They changed the menu and possibly owners. They still have G Free options but I left feeling disappointed. It wasn't as amazing as I remember.

We have experienced issues with our Ford Focus and this business has been very willing to work with us to ensure the vehicle is repaired correctly and ensuring that if the problem is important to safety fix that issue over something less critical. 

This business has also been very willing to have a look at our vehicles in a pinch and in some cases no-charge.

Customer Server.. look no further than OK Tire

Ok. Those fast food Mexican restaurants can kiss my habanero. 

What's going on in Airdrie? The food scene is starting to get rather respectable here. Goto love it. 

Now. This place is the real deal with amazing home made not from a can Mexican food!! Both our dishes were as good as we have ever had and this includes eating in Mexico. 

I love these small out of the way places who's owners really care and have pride in what they are doing. This is one of those places. So please, don't pass this place by... U won't regret it.

Really great Mexican food---worth getting off the highway for. Delicious carnitas and horchata. Guacamole that restored my faith in this most popular--but far too often ordinary--of dips. I would love to see this place constantly full.
Great customer service!  We have been tons of times and always happy with the service and the great ice cream
Very good pricing. Clean and comfortable restaurant. Friendly service. I loved the Vietnamese sub.

Tried this place out last night for the first time. Service was slow and inefficient. The rib end appetizer was very good. My wife had brisket and spicy fries, which she liked, but needed to exchange spicy for regular. They are spicy!! I had pulled chicken sandwich. All I can say is SODIUM CHLORIDE OVERLOAD!  Terribly salty, I guess to try to make the beer flow. This place is not likely to be on my return list and shouldn't be on yours unless you have outstanding kidney function or just love a good salt lick.

Good little Vietnamese joint.
Have eaten here a few times and haven't been disappointed yet.
Dynamite!!! Great food! Very fast! Surprised it's not kore busy to be honest. I'm usually not a fan of these over priced wanna be healthy establishments but I will be back without a doubt.

Best Walmart in my opinion in Calgary and area. 

Clean. 

Decent staff. 

Food is well stocked. 

Clothes are neat and well laid out. 

Change rooms are cleaner than any other location. 

I live in Calgary and drive to this location for the above reasons.

Place is now called Tequila & Taco

It beyond boring flavours don't give you the Mexican experience 

Flautas No flavour next to no sour cream & cheese 

Sopa Aztec water down tomato soup that tasted like vegetable broth far to many chip

Guacamole was excellent salas was tasty & hot

Won't be back
excellent service, our waitress Hanna was great, all the food was amazing the salad dressing however was bland, but the BBQ  & all there sauces were good, definitely will be back

Sorso Coffe Co. - the embodiment of the modern coffee shop. 

Being a Calgary native, I am well versed in the coffee culture of YYC and its surrounding area. I have visited shops all over and constantly search for a place where I feel at home. Enter Sorso Coffee Co, the surprising addition to an already stacked coffee scene of Calgary and area. 

Sorso serves local, independent coffee and searches far and wide to feature 'guest roasts' from other small batch producers. Its so nice to be able to switch it up from the excellent house blend (from Rosso Coffee!) To another roast that I would never have had the chance to try. 

The food is all made in house from scratch and is very unique. The daily soup always hits the spot, unless its early in the day in which I highly recommend the breakfast options. If you find yourself looking for a place to relax at night, they serve a wonderful selection of wines and even draught beer. 

The ambiance is great and is a place where I find myself spending long hours studying, conversing, or just listening to the constantly updated music selections curated by the management team. 

Sorso is a wonderful surprise in the growing community of Airdrie that I constantly make the short 15min trek from Calgary to enjoy, and you should too.

their chicken wings are phenomenal! they have an amazing smokey flavour and are a nice size. they're pretty pricey.. but if you go on wing night they are amazing. had some bitchy servers once in a while, but overall the staff is usually awesome. even on their party nights, security are calm and collected in urgent matters and don't use excessive force on their patrons. (seriously watched a drunk guy try to choke out another drunk guy and security handled it very well... hahahaa!) bartenders are great and take the time to chat a little and ask for your name just to give you that personalized service. the manager gave us a sample platter one night when they were fairly new and we tried the turkey, brisket, chicken, and a rib and they were all soooo amazing. tender and smokey. love this place.

Service is absolutely horrible will never return ordered frozen yogurt  sat down to wait for it after 10 minutes went to ask for it. It was siting on counter melting. Staff could not take the time to call out it was ready The name is Freshii this implies fresh food the mango on the yogurt was canned or frozen not fresh. Should be zero stars but min is 1 on app

We went there with our 9 and 11 year old. We didn't feel too welcome at all by the manager because we bought our 2 girls with us who behaved very well and it felt too "upper class" to even go there with kids even if they are older. Not a place to go with kids even though kids are allowed. 

The lasagne was good but a bit burnt on top which I didn't like. The Alfredo pasta was flavourless. Not too good. Was disappointed that they had no pizza for a month when we went there. 

The waitress was sweet. But the manager ignored us and went for the people who looked like they had more money to spend and talked to them about the variety of wines. 

There was a sign when I came in that said something like no hats allowed or take off your hats. That was fine with me but a bit taken aback by that sign which kind of set the negative tone in a sense. 

Don't think I would go again because it felt like setting a foot in a stranger's house and felt awkward there. Food was good though but hard to enjoy myself.

This place is brutal! Literally had to push our meals to edge of the table asked for the bill and walked across the street and bought pulled pork from Costa Vida. Waste of time and $60 I'll never see again.

Went in after a friend said how good it was. Authentic Mexican food served by great people. Had chicken tacos, and they were just like my last trip south. 

A true diamond in the rough. Don't let the hotel scare you away!  I talked to an inspector that I work with, he confirmed the kitchen is very clean!

Authentic tacos~ I put each of the 3 types of salsa dips in my tacos to make it more flavorful/spicy for me! Love horchata, but ask for little ice..or else you'll finish the drink within seconds. Margarita is bland. Tres leches cake is a MUST..so moist!!!! Even if you're full, order it to go!

Terrible haircuts! iv gone to this place many times because of the price and location, but it's true what they say you get what you pay for... I don't know how many times they have cut the back of my neck to short or crooked! Also when you ask for a number above 1 or 2 they like to make room for your ears? It's the actual number you wanted on top and cut to a 1 on the bottom, which sounds nice but ends up rounding your head (doesn't help when you cutting the hairs they missed). I recently got a hair cut from the older guy there and he gives the worst haircuts! You know how people line up the side of your hair to the top well one side looks good the other he shaved it off with a zero instead of having a line that goes forward then up it basically goes straight up to the top up my head! They have lost my business and I'll be glad to spread the word around not to go there I wouldn't want anyone else to pay for this haircut. (Get people who know how to cut hair and have people skills before opening a barber shop)

I've been to Sorso a few times now, despite living in Calgary this coffee shop keeps me coming back every time I find myself north of the city for business. The Café is warm and inviting with a modern-rustic atmosphere; highlights are the restored bar taken from a barn and some of the coolest light fixtures I have ever seen!

Their coffee is locally sourced from Rosso and they also offer premium guest batches from across Canada, both are great for those who appreciate more than your standard Tim's or Starbuck's brew. This theme extends to their beer selection, yup beer in a coffee shop; it doesn't get better than that! On my most recent visit they had an in-house beer sourced from a local brewery and beer sourced from Grizzly Paw in Canmore (Beaver Tail Raspberry on my last visit). They also had Guinness and Kronenbourg for people looking for a familiar premium beer. This "locally sourced" + "international bests" is a winning approach in my eyes. I also noticed they had a ton of teas from Calgary's own Tea House, although I haven't gotten around to trying any yet I do like the clear effort to partner with local businesses.

The food menu is constantly changing, with a good variety of sandwiches, wraps and desserts. I typically go with one of their feature sandwiches and the daily soup which has not disappointed on any occasion. The staff is always happy to take my order and answer any of my questions. I would definitely recommend stopping by next time you're in the area!

P.S. They have a cozy meeting room in the back that can sit 10-12 comfortably, great hidden secret for students and professionals who want to make their next group or team meeting a memorable one.

Very very excited to have Marble Slab in Airdrie now.  I was visiting family in Airdrie and I dont have to jet to Calgary anymore!  Best ice cream in town by far.  they dont have MS in NY but do have Coldstone, which I feel isnt as good.  regardless, thumbs up for MS in Airdrie!

omg! BEST spring rolls i have ever had. they are a great size and soooo flavourful. the pork really adds great flavour. the pho was also really good but the spring rolls definitely did it for me. yum yum new fav!

Decided to try Tony's last night and was not disappointed.
Prices were great, and serving sizes were even better.

We tried the Shrimp salad rolls, Grilled pork + shredded pork vermicelli, and the Shrimp pork chicken vermicelli.

Everything tasted great lots of meat and veggies to last the entire dish to the last bit. Our only criticism was that each order could come with more fish sauce as there was about enough for half the serving size. And there could be an extra shrimp or two in item 61.

I ordered for take out and food was hot and waiting for me when I arrived 15mins later. This will be out new go to Vietnamese restaurant.
Great Vietnamese restaurant! Service is good and the food is amazing. I always order the chicken noodle soup and for the portion they give, I fill up fast.

Absolute horrible experiance. Went in to shave off my beard after 6 months. I asked for hot shave with certain expectations.  However, I received a border line, dry, straight razor shave. Not one ounce of shaving cream was used. Very painful experiance that I would not recommend this place to anyone. Rating 0/5 however this isn't available.

My wife and I ate here tonight and everything was awesome.  The decor, service and food were the best we've had in a long time.  Portions weren't huge, but they were filling.  We will definitely be going back.

If you have a pile of money then this is the place for you! The vets are obviously not competent as every move has to be backed up by tests all of which cost you. They do not appear to be able to diagnose anything without you spending a big pile of cash. I have heard that this environment is due to Dr Dan so I have stopped going to this clinic and hope you will boycott it too!
Fantastic, authentic Mexican food and atmosphere. The owners are genuinely sweet. Try it for yourself. Support this local business and these lovely people!

Been here a few times. The first time we went it was really good. Second time they forgot to add my spring rolls to my dish. Third time my grilled short ribs were super chewy and tasted like it had been re-heated, rice was dry and tasteless. Went again today. My hubby ordered his dish with no carrots, nuts and sprouts because of medical issues. They did not remove them. I ordered the short ribs again with rice and spring rolls. It was supposed to be on rice, it came with noodles instead. The meat tasted like I was chewing on rubber bands. They didn't discount us for any of the mistakes they made and they were barely apologetic about it. The waiter is always rude. Always seems like he never wants to be there. Our money is better off spent elsewhere.

The staff is very friendly and very helpful. The food is authentic and delicious. Their desert menu only has 3 items but its more than enough as the choice are great. They're very accommodating to people with different food allergies or preferences.
This is just a wonderful place to go for a special occasion.Excellant food ! Will definately go there again. Too bad it took so long to get in. You need Reservations!
First time fabulous service and food was amazing we had a # 29 and 61 flavour was great food was hot and served hot

Really disappointed with my service from Enterprise.  I live maybe 30 minutes from Airdrie and they wouldn't pick me up, so I guess the slogan "Enterprise,  we'll pick you up" should really be "Enterprise, we'll pick you up as long as it's less than 30 minutes away"
Anyway,  I needed a truck to rent to replace my truck that was stolen and my insurance lady told me Enterprise would call me within 30 minutes to an hour to make arrangements.  No one called. I contacted them the next day and they said they had a car I could pick up. I said I don't want a car, I NEED a truck. My 4 kids are in a BMX program and I need to transport bikes and my one kid is in a band and plays drums and I need to move drums and other band equipment.  They said they would have a truck the next day.  I waited.  No one called the next day, I called them the following day, Saturday but they were closed by 12:00pm. Monday comes, still no call back, I call them.  I'm told they'll make some calls to arrange a truck. (And they were well aware that I need 3/4 ton not a 1/2 ton) Nobody calls back. Tuesday I call them and they tell me to come on Thursday.  Now at this point I've been without my vehicle for a week.  I go there on Thursday and they tell me they have a Kia car for me.  (Wtf!) I reminded them I NEED a truck. Apparently they had a truck there but it needed an oil change so I couldn't have it.  They try to convince me that's it a really nice Kia but it still doesn't work for what I need. So I took it anyway because I need a vehicle and was told by the next day (Friday) or Saturday by closing they'll have a truck for me. So they actually called me back on Friday  (imagine my surprise) and said I can come Saturday and get a truck.  (Woo hoo) so I double check that the truck will be an equivalent to my f250 that was stolen and capable of pulling a small trailer because I'm in the process of moving stuff from a farm I had items stored at into a storage bay because the farm sold and my friends were moving so I had to move my stuff ASAP, and Enterprise was well aware,  I made it clear many times that I need 3/4 ton, not a 1/2 ton and they said no, we have this dodge1500 for you. Well f*#*! That doesn't do me any good.  So long story short, I switched to a different company,  I'm now working through Budget and within 15 minutes of dealing with them at budget I'll be able to pick up a truck that meets my need on Monday morning. Dealing with a theft and insurance is stressful enough and the people at Enterprises just majority added to the headache and frustration.
The spicy seafood noodle soup comes in a huge bowl for the best price in town, great taste, great staff. Will come back very soon

For months we have been trying to get there for lunch. They would advertise online as being open and we would get there and it was closed. Finally this past Tuesday we made it in for lunch. We love Italian food and we're hoping to finally land a good restaurant in Airdrie. My recommendation? Skip this place. We had to wait for the waiter to show up from the back. There were only two other tables full while we dined. The menus were shabby pieces of paper. My fiance did not care for his spaghetti and meatballs. They were extremely bland. I had the manicotti which was actually quite tastey. We ordered a glass of wine and water with our meal and the waiter never returned for refills. Overall, we were very disappointed and skipped dessert...which never happens.

Excellent restaurant 
Food was very good fresh one of the best Mediterranean salads ever, it's different but amazing 

Fish was cooked perfect 
Service was excellence 
Recommend it to anyone 

There is a delivery and great pizza here 

Not sure why the the times only show until 2 pm it is open later 

Top 2 or three places in Airdrie if you ask me..

I do love this place! I find it to be a great addition to the city of Airdrie! No longer do we need to head into Calgary to grab a great cup of coffee. 

I love to meet my clients here and introduce them to the great pockets of independent businesses we have here in Airdrie. My only draw back is customer service, but it still has my heart for coffee, food and of course my favorite kombuchca! xo Sorso we all love you xo

Went here for a beer with some of my staff and it was full of energy and the bartenders/servers were awesome, however..the doormen that they have there are quite rude and power hungry it appears! 
When I tried to sign language to speak to the doorman through the door he waved me away, quite obnoxious of you ask me!   I was simply going to ask him a question and he didn't give me the respect a customer deserves. I also watched this same doorman bounce a guy's head off the curb for no reason except that this guy was trying to voice his opinion about something. Excessive force and rude to no end. 

Maybe try hiring respectful, non-juice monkey mentality door staff and you'd create a better review!

Trust me, you will be very disappointed. I would give this place no star if there was an option.

I am a Pho lover, and tried this restaurant last week out of curiosity. We ordered a chicken curry and a beef Pho soup. The curry is very thin and I have no idea whether the soup made with real beef bone soup or just a instant condensed bone dust soup. This reminded me of a only restaurant in fort mcmurray that provides Vietnamese Pho . 

There are so many great Vietnamese restaurants in Calgary area, but definitely not this one. All I said is based on my real experience. please judge by yourself. Enjoy!
The salsa was excellent. I really enjoyed my enmoladas. Definitely an authentic Mexican menu. Great service!

I think I'm getting lucky lately, because I'm actually getting a lot of amazing restaurants with very few duds. Tony's is no exception.

Only open for a few weeks at the time of this review, I've both dined in and done take-out at Tony's. The first night, we sat in. The location is a bit out of the way for a lot of people, and you might get lost if you don't know the area - Tony's is located in a more industrial part of town, and takes up one of the bays in an commercial condo building. That being said, it's nice and big with lots of breathing room - there are high ceilings, bright walls, and GIGANTIC booths - ours was pre-set for 4, but could comfortably hold 6-8 people with no issues. If anything, parking was the hardest part, as, despite this being in an industrial area, there's a fitness center in another nearby unit, so there's plenty of activity at both the restaurant and gym around dinner time. 

Onto the food! The menu is pretty large, and worth checking out. Lots of the standard fare, so I opted to go with the Vermicelli bowl both nights with spring rolls, sprouts, and lemongrass chicken. The service wasn't the fastest, but for a new place that probably wasn't expecting a huge night-time crowd, they did well. The food showed up within 20 minutes of ordering, and the portions are massive. I probably could have split my bowl in 2 if I wasn't enjoying it so much. The spring rolls were easily my favourite part as well - so much so that I ordered an extra order for my take-out, and tried the deep fried dumplings as well (neither of which disappointed). 

Calling for take-out, the order was really easy to place (everything on the menu is numbered, so even if you can't say what you want, you can always just give them a number). I asked about delivery, but with the grand opening, the hostess reminded me that I'd save 15% on my bill if I picked it up myself, so I opted for that route so I could get the extra appetizer...a good decision for sure!

Tony's is delicious, authentic, and has friendly service. I'll happily be going back here again, and I'll try to take my friends here as well. Also of note - the menu asks you to alert the server of any allergies you might have, so this might be a good place to check into if you love Vietnamese but can't have nuts!

Just moved to Airdrie a few months ago. I tried Supercuts, (needed a haircut for starting new job.......horrible), than Main St Barber(not bad but cut it all off, not what I wanted), and now at Towerlane Barber Shop. 

I am making this my new barber. Younger guy from Kuwait does an awesome job. He is social, but doesnt talk your ear off. Gave me the haircut I wanted, Twenty bucks cash.

Open M-F: 0900-1800 Sat: 0900-1700
AUTHENTIC and delicious. Staff is lovely and aimes to please. Order the enchaladas Verde.

We were looking for something good and filling food.  We decided to go to Tony's a Vietnames restaurant.  Located in the south eastern part of an industrial part of Airdrie. 
I normally have the yummy soup , but this time we ordered # 61 a very filling noodle bowl pork, chicken, beef and shrimp with spring roll.  (What I call fully loaded bowl) for a appetizer we had the shrimp lettuce wrap.  
The price was good and  so was the friendly service.  In fact we have never had bad food here or service. Really worth the stop for lunch.  If you don't have the time to sit in,  take out is available.  

During lunch rush Parking is limited if you want to park close to the front, there's more parking on the side of the building.

We had been excited to go check it out.
Disappointing. 
If you scroll to the Jessica V review...I completely agree.
It is a good cafe on it's best days but no where near very good or great.

To be fair I was only there once and have never had dinner there or gone at night etc.

The staff attire is very casual (obviously a policy) but looks uninviting/unprofessional and, well, just way too casual for a food service.
It's a nice place but the people working are not always food safe. I saw nobody wash hands even after blatantly sneezing into hands over an entire half hour visit. Serving food with long hair or long loose beards. Food prep guys in the back (owners?) wearing fuzzy sweaters/hoodies no aprons or gloves. Milk sat out and open on the counter the entire half hour we were there walked past many times by all staff even when no customers. $17 for one coffee a london fog and two admittedly pretty good muffins is tolerable but on the high end for such mediocre service.
Based on a single half hour visit:
Nobody will talk to you at all. Nobody asks how things are, nobody greets you or says good bye etc. No little things. We wondered about many things such as some kind of special tea they had and food selections but just couldn't get the attention of any of the six people that seemed to be either working or in the ownership group. It's not like we tried hard but we felt ignored. Couple this with the ultra casual look and it all comes off as poor service imo.

The coffee in our order was handed to me half full "the pot ran empty, but we will top you up later". I had to go up myself later and wait in a short line to finally get the promised top up to compliment the bottom of the pot he just gave me *shrug*. My expectation would have been "sorry sir but we are brewing a fresh pot, have this on the house while you wait and we will get your fresh cup out in a moment". Just a suggestion.
We are in Airdrie a lot.
Maybe we'll try it again someday, but maybe not.

Very good food! All three of us ordered # 61. Good sized portions. Tastey flavours. Prices are great. 
Our waitress' English wasn't great - but she was friendly. 
I'll be back.

Food, menu and drinks were great, but the service was lacking. I had a pulled pork sandwich with the tomato soup, and my lunch date had a chicken quesadilla; both were delicious! Our server forgot to bring over our drinks for about 20 minutes, forgot the refills later... forgot we asked for no oni

Bouncers are a bunch of women beaters and management ok with it.
Bouncers are a bunch of women beaters. My friend was bullied by the bouncer. Same bouncer that dragged the girl by the hair like a rag doll. Manager was backing his bouncer's assoult. Their excuse always is that people were too drunk. My point being is they probably over serve all the time and have untrained bouncers to deal with the consequences. Shame on the management and staff.
Awesome food! Great tea! Coffee is good if you like a lighter roast with a lot of flavor.

My wife and I love this place - it's got a real charm owing to some creative decorating, including a repurposed bar (very cool)

The Rosso coffee is great, and they make a mean breakfast sandwich aptly named the Mac Daddy, which comes 4 ways, my favourite being with their homemade sausage patty.  The egg is perfectly done, and comes with a tangy mayo that pairs nicely.
The food was very good. Not a lot for the money but good quality. Service was decent and cheerful. I would go again.

The wife and I are big fans of Vietnamese cuisine and have hit all the local places.  This one we were avoiding for some time due to the fact that the prices are significantly higher here than the other restaurants.  We finally decided to give it a try....

We walked into what looked like a very Greek restaurant, standard pillars and archways you would see common in most traditional Greek establishments.  Confusing, but whatever.  There were 2 other couples in the place, far from busy.  The menu was very lacking when compared to all other similar restaurants.  
 
I ordered a lemongrass chicken and noodle stir-fry with mixed vegetables.  The wife ordered a beef stew.  

The beef stew:
Served in the standard huge bowl with one exception.  The giant bowl had a foot on the table about 1.5 inches across.  Tiny little base, huge bowl?  Put your spoon in and you nearly tip the bowl.  I figured a certain someone will be wearing their soup/stew soon.  As for the taste, I'm not sure how you can call it a beef stew when its made from tasteless chicken broth with a couple small chunks of beef in it, a handful of noodles and almost nothing else.  Disappointing. 

The chicken/noodle/veggie stir-fry:
I don't know how this is called a stir-fry at all.  This dish was 75% raw peppers and onions, 10% noodles that had just come out of the fires of hell waiting to melt your face off, 2% frozen chicken that was still frozen despite sitting on the noodles, and 13% grease (no, not sauce, grease!).  No sauce, no lemgrass, no spices, no flavour.  The only thing was that cooked was the noodles.  I probably would have been more impressed if they just gave me a plate with whole peppers and onions for me to chop up myself, and a glass of grease for a drink. 
Unbelievable. 

We both are not people that complain, but we were extremely close.  Instead we just smothered everything in the one thing they couldn't screw up, bottled hoisin sauce, and managed to choke half our meals down before giving up.  

We waited for the bill for a while. and continued to wait. and waited some more.   Just as I stood up to go to the counter to inquire about the bill we finally received our drinks.  

And they charge a premium price?!   What makes this premium in any way?

Needless to say we won't be back.

Authentic delicious food made fresh from scratch! The atmosphere is lovely. Lasagna and manicotti were delicious. The tiramisu is off the charts. Love the live music on the weekends. So glad we have this hidden gem in Airdrie.

I just got this pizza for the first time and does look like deep dish but It is just  crust I don't think that I would ever order it again. That is not what deep dish is. More like bread whit toppings . 
where can you find a good pizza in this place

My boyfriend and i came here last weekend. Service was pretty good. I tried a Raspberry beer, not sure of the brand, and it was really good. The food was incredible, although a tad pricey for the portion sizes, and also no descriptions of menu items which would have been more helpful. We tried the brisket, pork ribs, and smoked (hot) chicken wings.Ive never had brisket from a restaurant before but it was amazing! The chicken wings were probably the best I've ever had. Our sides were the baked beans, potato salad, cornbread, and poutine with brisket gravy. All so so so perfect. Highly recommend this place and we will be back!

GLUTEN FREE HEAVEN!

Everything on the menu but the burrito can be gluten free.  And everything is so fresh and yummy!

After our 1st visit we bought salsa and corn tortilla to take home.  Huge bag of tortillas that aren't like the crappy ones you buy @ the supermarket. They don't fall apart.

Everything I have had on the menu has been wonderful and makes me want more!
Interesting location being in a kind of industrial area but delicious food and great atmosphere. I highly recommend it here! Good food and don't have to go to the city!

Stay away from this location period! I went in for an oil change and came out with damaged side rockers on my car. The kids in the shop bottomed my car out on the ramp. They admitted they damaged my car and told me they would tell the manager. The manager stated he didn't like the way the scratches looked underneath and denied the claim. These guys are crooks. I raised it to the franchise owner and was told regardless of the staff admitting they damaged my car and seeing it on video, apparently it doesn't show much. But you can see the staff rushing to my car, They refused to repair the damages.

Go anywhere but here!. The good thing is I am a member of a few car clubs and enjoy the pleasure of show and shines. I will do everything in my power to inform everyone I know of my experience.

There was no second attempt to fix this at all.  You were completely rude and unprofessional and stated plain and simple that you would not do the right thing.

Again my recommendation is to Stay Away from Mr. Lube in Airdrie Walmart location period! Visit Jiffy Lube, Lube Express, even the dealership! But stay away from this location period!  Or anything owned by Prairie Lube Ltd.  I have even had great service with Mr Lube Locations in Calgary.

Excellent dinner in Airdrie!
I was so impressed with Il Forno. 
I'm staying at the Airdrie Hampton Inn and the front desk girl told me about a delivery app called "Skip The Dishes."  Exhausted, I decided to give it a try and that's how I discovered I'll Forno. Incidentally, the delivery service was so easy to use - very impressed. 
Spaghetti Carbonara - perfection. Absolutely classic preparation as it should be. So many restaurants can't make this dish. 
Ribeye Steak - excellent. Cooked to perfection and seasoned just right. The veggies and potatoes were just as good. The accompanying sauce was mind-blowing. So good that I used it with the bread rolls. Yum!
The Cheesecake was insanely good. I was expecting a standard factory-made cheesecake that so many restaurants (even good ones) use. The cheesecake at Il Forno was obviously house made. Crazy-good. 
One more note - I get delivery all the time and I was so impressed with the way this kitchen "plated" the food in the takeout containers. Someone really took the time to make a nice presentation.

We were headed out for a Monday night dinner, and since it was getting a little late, this was one of the few places that was open for Vietnamese.  It was overall a satisfactory experience.

Atmosphere: 3/5  The restaurant was spacious, clean, and quite large for the number of patrons.  I like the open area and it was an interesting space with some pillars.  It was quiet and we were one of two tables there.  

Food: 3/5  I had the grilled beef and salad rolls on vermicelli.  I was happy to be able to substitute the spring rolls with salad rolls!  Overall, I enjoyed my dish which ended up being quite large.  There was quite a bit of beef!  The taste was ok, although I would've liked more carrots and fresh vegetables relative to meat.  The fish sauce was ok - I thought it was pretty typical but maybe a bit dilute.

Service: 4/5  We were attended to very quickly; our waitress was efficient and friendly

Price: 3.5/5  Reasonable for the size and amount of food

Overall: 3.5/5  Overall satisfactory experience with generous portion sizes in a quiet clean environment; taste was okay.  I would have to try some of the other Vietnamese restaurants in Airdrie as comparison.
Our favourite Airdrie pub!  Great beer, food and service!   This place never disappoints!

First and last time my boyfriend and I will be in!
We came in for a light snack and some coffee.  The boyfriend ordered an Americano and two Turkey wraps to stay.  Not too difficult since the wraps were in the display cooler.  Besides the young lady who promptly made my boyfriends (enjoyable) Americano, it took 10 minutes to get our wraps which we had to ask for... Which all they (one of the six useless people) had to do was take them out of the cooler. 

Overall this place is overpriced with shit customer service

Just a bunch of people standing around behind the counter drinking coffee and not making any.

You'd think that someone, like the owner would be reading these reviews and try and do something about the f...ing service here because when I read the reviews, I just stay away from your restaurant.
 So guess what...... that equals lost revenue for you.
   Now do you get it?

GO ANYWHERE ELSE BUT HERE. Went to get a fuel filter change done today, which was recommended yesterday after the slowest oil change of all time, the man working told us it would be about 20 minutes. So we waited an hour. Then, he came to the waiting area holding my air filter and asked if they could change that too, and that it would be done immediately, I agreed seeing as how they had already taken it out. 20 minutes later he comes back and tells us that they were waiting for the fuel filter to be delivered (delivery was never mentioned) and that they were going to put the air filter back in because they didn't have a new one available. After 2 HOURS he cashed me out and then told me that not only was there an engine leak, but that the bolt for the air filter box was broken. When the vehicle was looked at yesterday, none of this was mentioned. I left with a new fuel filter, a hole in my exhaust, an engine leak, a broken bolt, and -$80. Customer service is EMBARRASSING.

Stay away from this location period! I went in for an oil change and came out with damaged side rockers on my car. The kids in the shop bottomed my car out on the ramp. They admitted they damaged my car and told me they would tell the manager. The manager stated he didn't like the way the scratches looked underneath and denied the claim. These guys are crooks. I raised it to the franchise owner and was told regardless of the staff admitting they damaged my car and seeing it on video, apparently it doesn't show much. But you can see the staff rushing to my car, They refused to repair the damages.

Go anywhere but here!. The good thing is I am a member of a few car clubs and enjoy the pleasure of show and shines. I will do everything in my power to inform everyone I know of my experience.

One of the franchise reps tried to Caution me "a vield threat" against telling my story. Here it is. And my review is STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION and any others owned by Prairie Lube Ltd. Especially if this is how they treat customer's and respect your vehicle.

Please do not go here. If you have a last minute emergency and your regular vet is not available or closed, go to a 24/7 vet. 

My dog randomly started to act differently. He was severely lethargic, didn't have an appetite and was breathing a little weird. The only reason why we took him there was because our regular vet was not available and he needed medical attention immediately. They were great with booking him in without any notice but that was only "good" experience. 

A couple things:

1) the Dr could not figure out what was wrong with our dog. 
2) the Dr recommended he have our dog for two whole days at the vet on IV. Looking back, I am incredibly mad. He was locked in a tiny crate for 12 hours on an IV.  He could have been home with us. 
3) they mis-labeled some of the medication. He told us to give 4 tablets every morning (total of 200 mg). It ended up being 600 mg every morning - we were overdosing our dog. When we confronted the Dr about this, he tried to wiggle his way out of his mistake and said "I planned on contacting you". WE called him. He then said "oh, the next morning, give him two tablets. 
4) we contacted our original vet and the Dr at city centre refused to fax over the documents. We had to get our vet to physically call and demand the records. 

There were so many more issues that went on between the vet and our dog. I am angry and grieving and frustrated. 

We lost our dog to leukemia. Our original vet took over after 2.5 weeks of city centre doing nothing except charge us $2000.00. Our vet found out what was wrong with him after one day. 

This was the worst experience I have ever had with a vet. 

Please please please do not take your animal here. They truly are treated like animals - not family members.
Fast, fresh and delicious! Always great service and consistent quality. Best Vietnamese food in Airdrie by far!
Don't judge from the outside. Friendly staff great food. Best Mexican in airdrie by far.

Last month my dog was ill and city center was the only place open because it was a holiday. I was certain I was going to get taken to the cleaners for brining my dog in on a holiday. I was wrong.
The vet was amazing. Treated her symptoms, and had no interest in charging me more than the  minimums.
So far I'm really happy with this clinic and will be using them in the future.

Rarely have I encountered such brazenly rude and spiteful "customer service". After two items we ordered failed to arrive, we asked for the food to be brought out. They first insisted the food had been provided, which they then admitted was false. They had promised to provide the food, which I followed up on after waiting a further half an hour. This was when I was told that I would have to pay, again, for the food that had never arrived. At this point, I was so angry that my appetite completely died, much like my aspirations to ever eat from this place again. I'm almost in disbelief that such inequality could happen in a legal business establishment. 
Formerly a loyal customer,
Never Again.
Not squeaky clean. Rush job. Got butchered. 25 with tip.

I've been here multiple times hoping service would get better but it seems to be getting worse.  Today it took 25 mins before anyone took my order.  I finally went up to the till myself to place the order.  And it took them 1hr to bring my steamed granola and latte.  As I get to the bottom of my drink I discover some green onion looking piece of food in my mug.  I think it's time to start visiting other coffee shops.  It is a shame because I really enjoyed coming here.
Worst bar ever. Bouncer uses excessive force on females and the management supports it .

Wow. The place we wanted to go for dinner tonight was closed, so, based on "star rating" , we chose Vietnamese Western Cusine... and regret it, painfully. I never leave yelp reviews; this is actually my first; but this needs to be said.

First off - my wife had vegetarian spring rolls. They were tiny portion sizes, and barely had filling... the little filling they did contain was just shredded carrot.

I had beef pho, and asked for extra meat, and I am SO glad I did. I got about 6 pieces of beef total... what the hell would normal be? What is this, pho for ants? Seriously though.

My wife had chicken pho, and it contained about 3 pieces of chicken. 

We left severely disappointed, super hungry, and having wasted money.

The server was friendly though.. Food was terrible, lacked flavor, and portions were intended for small children on a starvation diet.
Was in area and love Vietnamese food. Gave this place a try and loved it. Got number 35 for take out it was delicious and a good size portion. Plus got the discount. Great food for great price.

My family and I have frequented Sorso since they opened up this past year. The coffee is great & the treats and other food we have had there are also very yummy. The staff are friendly, although we are regulars now, so most of them know us :)  I will warn newcomers that it's definitely a small shop feel, so don't expect everything the second you order it (it's always worth the wait). Also good to know, they have a little kid friendly space to play as well as a meeting space that you can "rent" with all the proceeds going to Community Links, a great local support network. All I know is that being there as often as I am it's obvious the owner has been thoughtful about what he wanted for his shop, from the decor to the menu to how the shop functions for the community. This patron definitely appreciates it :)

We had originally planned on visiting another restaurant for supper in Airdrie; sadly the reservations did not pan out, so we decided to try Il Forno - apparently voted one of the best pasta restaurants in town for 2016!  

Atmosphere: 4.5/5  The restaurant is a little difficult to find, being on the second floor on the side of a mall complex and out of the way of the rest of the city, but the ambience more than made up for it!  Climbing the stairs into the restaurant felt like walking into little Italy, with the mild lighting, decor including fences, and live music.  Busy and lively on a Friday evening... Very thoughtful use of space and interactive staff!  More than enough parking and an elevator for those who have difficulty with stairs.

Food: 4/5  We had the calamari, linguine alle vongole, and salmone to share.  I haven't had calamari in a long time so really enjoyed the crunch and flavour!  The linguine was good - not too rich yet tasty; salmon was also tasty and maybe just a very little bit drier than expected.  Good variety of seasonal vegetables and maybe a little more buttery than I would usually prefer.  I love the really hot fresh buns that came in the beginning!

Service: 3.5/5  Since it was a Friday evening, staff were visibly busy so it took some time for the kitchen to be ready for our order.  I can see that staff were trying their best though.

Price: 3.5/5  reasonable for a nice Italian meal with great ambience

Overall: 4/5  Overall I enjoyed my experience here - the owners have definitely put a lot of thought and passion into generating an authentic and interactive experience for the patrons!  This would be a great place to celebrate special occasions; would love to try some of their other dishes.

This was surprising! We had never been here (or any of their locations) before so for some reason in our minds we were expecting a fast food type set up. We walked in and it is a full- on full service restaurant that is decorated in nothing like anything Vietnamese I have ever seen.

It was a Saturday afternoon and the place was dead so we had our pick of tables. The server was really quick and didn't say much through- out our stay. We ordered an appie and had to ask for some side plates when it came out, not a problem. But, the food was just mediocre. For this reason we (I) will continue our (my) search.

I am definatley a fan. But not of their prices. Are they injecting this ice cream with gold? Cause they better for the price....

One liter of ice cream should NOT cost $14.00. No matter how life changing the aforementioned ice cream is. Lol.
Excellent italien restaurant! Loved the lasagna. A guy was playing music also, good ambiance. I'll definitely recommend the restaurant. * a bit over price

This Walmart Supercenter is probably my fave Walmarts in the Calgary area. Their shelves are always stocked, there are employees actually on the floor if you need anything and this place is GINORMOUS - I could easily wander around here for 3 hours and not be bored.

However, huge diesel trucks with the dangling metal bull testicles double parked in the lots will give you the indication of the clientele also wandering aimlessly inside. I'm pretty sure this location is where all those "People of Walmart" photos originated.

I've made the mistake of coming here a few times on the weekend in the afternoon - the hoards of people decked out in their finest sweat pants struggling to push their carts full of kids while their other kids are running every which way screaming down aisles makes my ovaries shrivel up like raisins.

So if you want to get some efficient shopping done, hit this place up early on the weekend or during the weekday/night. Otherwise, if you're looking to do some people watching and maybe make your own submissions to POW, feel free to take a seat at the McDonald's or Tim's located just inside the entrances.

Been there a few times now for a haircut and beard trim.
They seem to make up prices on the spot. First time i was there, I was charged almost $50. Second time, i was charged $34 and the third and final time, i was charged $25.
Haircuts are just ok, you could save your money, go to great clips and you'd get just as good or better. The only reason i gave two stars instead of one is because at the very least, they have always done a nice job trimming my beard.
I won't be back.

Enjoyed the food, was a little overpriced but delicious. I managed to come out with my little one, they have a high chair but not much else for little kids so come prepared with a sippy cup and something to occupy them if you are adventurous. I would still try and come here for a nice night out with the hubby. Airdrie has a couple hidden gems and this is one of them.

If I could leave less stars I would! We called this center with a high priority issue on New Years eve more than 3 hrs before closing requesting (6:46pm) to come in for assistance manually expressing our recently handicapped dogs bladder (he had a stroke the day before) The receptionist put us on hold for 15 mins and 35 secs AFTER we spoke to her. We called back thinking that she may have forgotten us on hold,only to be told that she needed to talk to the vet because we weren't existing clients. She thought the vet was in surgery (how do you not know where the vet is) and that she was starting to get busy, she was VERY rude. Told us we would have to leave a phone number and she would call us back.. which she never did. A vet assistant could have easily assisted us, and our dog was in distress, (as were we). Walkins, emergencys or call ins apparently not welcome at all, but I sure hope her NYE party was as much fun as she had hoped. We are transplants from Calgary and looking to add a local vet, most certainly will not be this one.

With the continuation of the cold freeze in Alberta during the holidays, it was time for something warrrrrmmm.... and pho is always a great idea!  This time, we decided to check out this Vietnamese restaurant in Airdrie for a quick dinner, especially since I got off late from work.

Atmosphere:  3.5/5  Overall neat and spacious; glad to see lots of take out that night along with at least a few other tables.  It is located in the industrial area a bit out of the way from the city, but not inconvenient by any means.  There are only a few parking spaces in front of the restaurant but more along the side of the building complex.

Food: 4/5  Since I was really hungry, I enjoyed this large bowl of rare steak pho tremendously!  Great portion size and tasted delicious and really hot soup which I greatly enjoyed

Price: 4/5  good price for portion size

Service: 3/5  Overall efficient

Overall: 4/5  Overall a great vietnamese restaurant for a quick and filling supper especially in this cold weather!
Food here is fantastic as always. Love coming here other with a group of friends or to come here to study. Always a relaxing and chill environment. Best casual place in town.

I have used Enterprise in Airdrie dozens of times to travel around Alberta on business. I also used them when I needed a replacement vehicle as I was in an accident and my truck was being repaired. They are also conveniently located next to an excellent auto body repair shop.
They have always provided excellent service. picked me up from, and even dropped me off at my house after the rental. The vehicles are always clean and well maintained. When they didn't have a vehicle in the class that I reserved, they immediately upgraded me at no extra charge. They have also been very flexible with return times. I appreciate that no business can satisfy every customer all of the time, but having used Enterprise for 7 years, I know for a fact that they certainly try very hard. 
My two cents...
Almost 2 hours for delivery. (Restaurant is 1.3km away) food arrived cold and was spilled in the bag.

My oldest Babygirl works here, that's why I was initially going to come but she wasn't working this day:( My friend was in the mood for pub food which is a rarity for me, I thought it was a bad idea but we went and I was delighted to see they had some GREAT menu options. I had the Filet Mignon w/button mushrooms, roasted potatoes, veggies and gravy for less than $20.00. There was a LOT of LOVE cooked in that little 6oz, I left full and HAPPY! I will be back. Lots of big screen, looks like a great place to watch the UFC.

I brought in my daughter when she was a baby to have her ears pierced. Brandi and Ryen did a amazing job. They were able to pierce both her ears at the same time. She cried for about 20 seconds and that was it. The jewelry that was included was so cute and never gave us any problems. I would highly recommend everyone to go here!!!
This is life! Seriously delicious!!! Staff are very friendly, food is amazing AND they deliver!! Thank you for coming to airdrie!!

I enjoyed the burger. Good busy atmosphere if you want to be in a loud social gathering type restaurant. Not as we suited for a one on one quiet conversation type meal.
The free bus ride to flames game is a huge bonus. Drink down a beer before stepping onto the bus and you can have a worry free experience of no parking, and being able to have a couple more beers at the game. Seriously I hope to never drive to a flames game again with this service. Remember to tip your driver!!

Ive never had a tattoo from here but I would definitely highly recommend Ryen. She is very professional and knows how to make you feel comfortable as she's is getting the job done in a very timely manner. I have received 3 piercings from her, not once have i had any problem other than one falling out on a Sat. Night after just getting it done on Friday. I couldn't get it back in so she generously re pierced me Monday afternoon. My guess its probably one of the painful ones too..:)  ive seen some of the tattoo work that comes out of the store. Most of it looks great. Don't know any of the artists there but I don't think I would have a problem going there for a tattoo. I have plenty of them, mostly from Primal Instinct in BC

This place is the real deal. The chicken shawarma is really good. Great flavour with each bite. Glad they moved to airdrie, saves me the trip back to Calgary. And they deliver. You will not be disappointed

Took my cat here yesterday around 1:30 since he was having trouble going to the bathroom and this clinic is 10 minutes away from home and I wanted to get him help ASAP. No one in waiting room. Receptionist (who looked bored) said that there were no vets in the clinic and that instead of waiting the 15-20 minutes for one to come in I should just go somewhere else. No suggestions as to where I should go, just to go somewhere else. Luckily I made it to the vet hospital in Calgary, and he's being looked after. But why say that you are open but not have the staff there to do the job?? My poor cat had to suffer that 20 minutes or so longer because no one was able to look after him. I was livid. Never taking either my cat or my dog to this clinic. Even though it's the closest clinic to me I will not be going back.

2nd visit. Would prefer kid free all the time. But after 8 it is kid free.  Food is great, noise level for some might be too loud. But we came to watch hockey and expected noise. Our waitress was excellent and intuitive, will most definitely come back.

Awesome family friendly dining. Went with my two kids and they cleared their plates. I had the turkey clubhouse and was stuffed afterwards ,portions are so big:) great wait staff and awesome food. Would recommend to anyone

This is the only place you should go to if you're in Airdrie for Lebanese/Middle Eastern Food. 

Sam is an amazing man. Such a kind and caring person who truly loves his food. He makes EVERY SINGLE THING from scratch. His Chicken Shwarma is perfectly seasoned. His Beef has a nice savoury flavour. The Donair Special is a huge STEAL at $5. 

Other key things. Sam has worked in the camps up north for over 40 years so he knows how to fill a stomach. I went in because of a sign on the side of the road that said Donair $5. When I got in there the decor was nice, but the place was empty. (THIS SHOULDN'T BE THE CASE). Sam was working behind the counter when I got there. 

We talked a little and I learned a lot about him. His care for his food is amazing.

His house dessert is amazing. It is a small crepe which he fills with a cream filling and then drizzles a simple syrup over top of it. I ate 6. 

The baklava is flaky and moist, just like it should be. There is a definite flavour of honey in it. 

The Tabouli is incredibly fresh and tastes of lemon juice on the end. 

 as I have already said Sam is kind and generous. He really believes in his food, and his work. 

I would HIGHLY recommend Sam's Eatery anytime you want good, high quality middle eastern food. 

I can't wait to try everything on his menu.

I have worked with Sunridge RV now for 8+ yrs, I have watched this company grow and learn and change... As have I as a Salesperson.  I have browsed many reviews and I applaud the happy customers that take the time to share their good experience.  
We have a great many 'happy campers' and that's underscored by the 5th Consumer Choice Award.  Every dealer has the customers that are unhappy for one reason or another and sadly these are the first to speak out.  I work with an outstanding group of people, we all share a common goal: 'to give the best service possible, and to build long lasting relationships with our customers!! It is a warm and friendly atmosphere here and our customers comment on it frequently.  I have had the pleasure of working with 'many' 3rd and 4th time buyers...so here's my personal Thank You to my Great Team for making my years here... The best!! And my thanks to all my happy and Loyal Customers who keep coming back.... !!
Sincerely Cheryl McCarthy

I've been there many times like at least 40 mostly because of friends. Have not ate there for a long time. Every time I ate chicken wings I felt like puking. A lot of people I know have had the same experience. The service is not bad but there were at least 5 times where either the chef or the cook where missing. No wonder why no one goes there. Honestly the worst bar in airdrie. Peace
Great food just don't go there on a weekend in the evening....it turns into a loud crazed drunk fest bar.

Damn, I had the worst/ kind of hilarious experience my last visit, and I just can't find it in me to go back. I raved about how delicious this place was and the first time I brought a friend here, the pho came out cold. I noticed right away because it wasn't cooking the rare beef! I stuck my finger in and it was lukewarm, kind of gross. When I told the waitress, she took the soup back and we could hear her put it in the microwave!!! The door closed, we heard the beeps, heard it running...LOL. It was pretty funny but needless to say we didn't want the soup. How can I recommend this place now? Bummer.

Nice restaurant but the buffet isn't that big. In fact, it's too small. Not enough selection and across the room, you can see the sanitation materials that a janitor would use. Not a big deal but makes the environment low rent. I had an okay experience but would recommend the Silver Star restaurant between no frills and the dolls store. Bigger and classier restaurant with much more food selection and still a very reasonable price for the buffet.

Oh Brewhouse. You disappointed me. I'm not sure we can be friends anymore. Sigh. 
I went to the brewhouse on Sunday October 18th for breakfast. It was ten after 10:00, however the door was locked. Perhaps they're closed I thought to myself, but my husband insisted they were always open on Sunday's and the sign on the door backed up his claim. I decided to call the restaurant. The phone rang and rang, finally answered with a tired "brewhouse". "Are you guys open today?" I inquired. "Uh we are open everyday at ten!" Sang the condescending male voice on the line. " well your door is locked." I replied. "Huh." I don't typically find that type of response helpful. " do you suppose someone could unlock it?" I asked. "Yeah I guess so!" Again, said in a sarcastic and condescending tone. 
So this dude comes and unlocks the door, looks at me and says " sorry. I was on the phone with some annoying lady."
I wanted to pour a gallon of sour milk on his head. Buddy, you're not funny. You're a condescending ass. 
I won't be back because of this guy. No one deserves to feel like crap for asking a question. 
Ps: let your female staff choose what to wear. The skirts are sexist. Unless you offer a skirt for your male employees as well, you're actually breaking the law.
Nice place, good food. They just need to turn the volume down a little it's nice to be able to the hear the person across from you.
For a buffet, the food was great.  Very busy place on a Friday night, seemed a bit understaffed. All in all good food good price.

Want a quick lunch at a great price this place it it!!! 
Staff was so friendly and seated us and asked for our drink order in a quick fashion.  The buffet selection was fresh and wonderful so much to choose from and such a small stomach. LOL. The food and the Desert was delicious and the price was out of this world!! 
Lunch with water for 2 people was under $20.00!! 
Don't have to worry about parking your vehicle, there is plenty of parking.  This place is a hidden gem!  We will be returning.

A friend of mine and her daughter mistakenly sat at one of Sam's patio tables thinking they were for the Quizno's next door. A Sam's employee very rudely told them to leave. When they complained to Sam himself, he screamed at them and said "I hope you fucking die!". No Sam, I hope your business dies.

Time for and update because this time it was much better.

Let me start by saying "THANK YOU" for adding a decent addition to your white wine list. This was a major complaint for me on our last visit.

We ended up here with some out of town guests who had never been to the Brewhouse so they were pretty pumped with the 'Canadian' menu. 

We got the perogies and steak bites to start that come with that steak sauce. Hello! The boys got burgers and they looked fantastic. Everything for our party came out as ordered. 

Yet again, we had to ask them to turn on the hockey game instead of baseball or basketball. With that many tv's you would think they could have a little bit of everything going on and if there is a hockey game happening we wouldn't have to ask at all.

The Manager came around (as they always do) to make sure everything was ok and it was of great relief not to have any complaints this time!

I met a work friend for lunch today at the Brew House.  Pretty nice place inside, lots of TV's with sports on, a big bar, lots of seating and nice staff.

I ordered the Canadian Burger and fries.  My friend ordered the beef dip and sweet potato fries.  We got our food pretty quickly.  Here is where they lost a star or two for me.  I understand they are a franchise, and you should get the same food no matter which restaurant you go to, but ugh...its so bad!

The fries were...fries.  Crinkle cut freezer fries.  Can't say much more.  The burger looked and smelled ok, it had potential.  Sadly, after I bit into it the potential left.  It had that grey pressed sponge look.  I hate when you bite into something SO overly processed that you can't even imagine what is in it making it that way.  Flavor was OK, just OK.  

Most chain restaurants are similar, they are what they are.  But I don't rush back to the Canadian Brew House.

From March 21, Calgary Herald:

While an impromptu act of charity might have only taken a day's work and some wheeling and dealing for those who did it, the woman who received it is still astounded almost a month later.
Chris Restall, a Calgary mom battling breast cancer, took her car to Tools in Motion in Airdrie to get a coolant leak fixed with a $250 gift certificate she'd won.
But she walked away with almost $2,500 worth of work done, and wasn't asked for a single cent of compensation.
She had already driven one car into the ground, travelling back and forth while sharing custody of her young son and getting to and from Foothills Hospital for cancer treatment, and she was well on her way to driving her latest ride, which only cost her $500 to buy, to a similar fate.
She just didn't know how close she was -- the guys at Tools in Motion spotted it.
"I live in my car -- I need my car," Restall said.
"I have responsibilities and without my vehicle that would just make my life so much more difficult."
Tools in Motion fixed the leak. They also replaced the tires, the fuel pump, the front wheel bearings, the brake pads and rotors, and the power steering hose, and they aligned the wheels, calling up partners Auto Value Parts Store, NAPA Auto Parts and Tire Wholesalers along the way in their goodwill endeavour.
"They definitely went above and beyond . . . I was very shocked, and I was quite pleasantly surprised," Restall said.
When she went to pick up the car, she said, the new tires were the first clues to what Tools in Motion had done.
"I didn't know how to react, quite honestly -- I wanted to cry," she said.
"They were just lit right up with all the work they did. They were standing there, shoulder-to shoulder, beaming . . . just smiling at me."
Maybe Tools in Motion doesn't want that money, Restall said, but thank-you notes and baked goods are definitely in order after their act of kindness.
--Damien Wood

I've been in twice, both times I had a different variation of their beef pho.

The broth was bland/ boring, even the sate option completely lacked flavor.

I can't say much else about it. It was a step up from hot water & noodle soup. 

I also tried the fresh chicken spring roll. It was ok (also boring) and made awkwardly large which made it messy to eat.

Nothing negative about my experience- clean venue, friendly staff- but also nothing worth repeating. Below average on taste.

I have an unusual car.  At 25+ yrs, they don't make parts for her anymore, so getting her through OOP was quite the experience.  These guys were helpful, did a great job, and after several months of hunting down a super rare part the install went brilliantly, they did what they needed to do and didn't charge me an arm & a leg for it like anyone else might have considering the issues I faced bringing her into Alberta at that age.  The engine heater issue was tricky, but they found a way to make it work.  They've done some great work on D's beater to keep it road-worthy this winter, and they're very friendly and knowledgeable guys.  I'll keep going back as long as I'm in the area, whenever my car needs something.  It's nice to find a good trustworthy mechanic so close to home.

I was so excited when I saw the 5 star review for this place and I was pumped to try it! I don't know what my fellow Yelper ate, but it probably wasn't what I ordered. Lucky her! 

I ordered the bun thit nuong (grilled pork vermicelli bowl) and the spring rolls. The spring rolls were ok, but there was nothing special about them and I didn't eat more than one. The bun thit nuong... perhaps the fattiest pork I have ever been served of which I couldn't eat at least half of it. 

For a $20 lunch meal (for one) you would never convince me to go back. What a waste of money. If you try this place I hope you have better luck than I did.
Great honest  guys! They took care of me and fixed my car for a very reasonable price after I got ripped off huge by Varsity Chrysler.

Probably the worst customer service and jewelry quality ever. Coated black jewelry isn't supposed to be put in healing piercings. When I had severe reaction to this with coating coming off inside my fresh piercing, they told me it was fine

It's hard to find much wrong with The Canadian Brewhouse in Airdrie.

It's a huge and well-decorated place. Sports pub high end. Lots of booths and tables and a massive bar. There's no shortage of seats and SO many TV's! Good-looking crowd too!

My server was the bartender, and he really went out of his way to provide spectacular service. It was not crazy busy but you could tell he was a pro. Super nice guy too. 

I had a chicken salad and it was fresh and delicious.

Great beer specials!

Why wouldn't you go?

I've been to this pub twice within the past few months because Bambino's hosts Rocky View Roller Derby events and I'm a sponsor.  I had heard from a local that this place attracts a rough crowd and overall may not be the most desirable place in town to hang out.  Well, it may not be, but I'm from small town Saskatchewan and this place is completely acceptable as far as I'm concerned.  It looks like it's been renovated and is rather nice.  The restrooms are better than many well used Calgary restaurants.  

I've only eaten buffet style here but I certainly had no complaints.  They actually made some sort of hot dip for nachos once and it was amazing.  The meal they provided for the Stampede event I attended a few weeks ago was great and they had a corn dish I'd never eaten before.  The drinks are inexpensive and the servers are attentive.  

As for the crowd, it has always had its characters and I'd not make bets on a single woman meeting her husband here.  However, I've had a good time and it's not a pretentious atmosphere.  There isn't much for natural light and they tend to keep the blinds closed.  They do face West (I think) and maybe the sun gets in one's eyes.  I'm not a huge fan of a dark room in the summer months, which really would be my only deterrent.  If you enjoy karaoke, Bambino's has that too, as well as a couple of pool tables.

I really hate giving a mediocre metric. I am more of a black or white kinda gal, so I will preface this review with a promise "to follow up" in the near future for a more definitive opinion. I also understand this is a fairly new location and they need to work out the kinks. They are pushing it with about a year of being open...

We have been here a few times before this review so I will give you a consolidated summary of the good and not so good.

One of our past experiences we had ordered our food and had to wait over an hour for it to come out while some people who came in after us were getting their orders before us. After we kicked up a fuss with our waitress she went in the kitchen and the food then came out luke warm and made wrong. I ordered my sandwich with cheese and after taking a bite found out there was none. So I sent it back for two deficiencies, cold sandwich, made wrong. Now this is what kills me... They put a piece of cold cheese on my already cold sandwich (you know, the one I already took a bite out of) and brought it back to me!!!! That is insane and begging for a negative review! It was obviously a calamity of errors between our waitress and the kitchen. After asking to speak to the Shift Manager because our experience was so horrible she did manage to make it right with her magical manager ways. 

On the same visit they had U.S. College Basketball on almost every tv but what doesn't make sense to me is the World Junior Hockey Championship was only on 2 small tv's that we could barely see from our table. Team Canada was playing, we live in Canada and we were at the Canadian Brew House. What????? 

Had I reviewed this location after this visit they would have received a one star rating and only because of their fabulous manager and that is about it. BUT I really want to like this place so I refrained.

This most recent visit when we were ordering drinks, I was interested in having a glass of wine. I know that they had been carrying Kim Crawford, Savignon Blanc by the glass, but to my dismay the wine list had changed (I had an old, sticky, menu in my hands). Not one decent white wine option and not one Savingnon Blanc available. Disappointed. Our Server suggested the Shiraz then I had to inform her that Shiraz is a red and Savingnon Blanc is white. Guess this is a "Brew House" so they may not know, but the staff should be familiar with their own menu. I know there are better options by the bottle, but I don't want a bottle, just a nice glass of wine with lunch. Not boat gas. They will need to change the 'by the glass' options before I come back again. And yes, I only drink wine~ not beer. 

Their 'by the glass' options are not the same as their 'by the bottle' options (which are pretty decent). Who is making these decisions and why do you choose to carry twice the inventory? Makes no sense at all! Obviously they are getting a contractual rebate or a lower cost/ higher margin from the 'by the glass' wine vendors.

I spoke to Drew, who was the shift manager about this when he came around to our table and he was fantastic! They are lucky to have him in their employ (he went around and spoke to everyone! A rarity). He was empathetic and offered a few different options to get around this swill they are now offering. Half price bottle Thursday or ordering a bottle and taking what isn't drank at the time, home. I will never do the latter because I won't pay double for a bottle of wine that I can buy at the liquor store, I am smarter than that and they have yet to win my loyalty as a customer to earn this. Drew did intrigue me with the Thursday option. 

Their Management Team is 'hands down' fantastic!!! And that is the only reason right now that they get three stars.

Just a few more minor notes. 1. The regular order of nachos is huge (like, can't wrap your arms around, kind of huge), perhaps they should offer a half size option. We felt really bad about wasting all the food that we couldn't eat because we were unaware of the size when we ordered. 2. Pickled jalapeños are waaaayyy better than fresh on nachos, we thought the fresh was just weird and a little uncommon. 3. Remove all wicker (nacho tray for example) from your restaurants. Anyone in the restaurant/ hospitality industry knows wicker can not be cleaned. 

I am looking forward to revisiting this location after all cylinders are firing together and updating my review!
First time. Falafel is gross! Baklava is way too buttery, won't be going back. Not recommended.
This place is cool for eating dinner, talking to friends or celebrating anything. Burgers are amazing with their fries.

Went looking for something to eat a bit later in the evening and couldn't find much open. Just when I thought Sam's Eatery was closed and was walking back to my car Sam himself let me in and made me something to eat on the spot. He mentioned that customer service is his specialty and his passion and talent show in his food. I had an amazing falafel and bought some desserts, and lunch items for the week. He didn't have any Baba Ghanoug left but went into the back and he made it on the spot! Doesn't get any fresher then that, and is wayyyyyy better than the store bought stuff (that goes for the amazing hummus here as well). You won't be sorry if you try Sam's Eatery, it is a way healthier option than any fast food joint, and everything really is delicious!  :)

the restaurant was dead inside & still the service was non existent & the food was some what edible, steak bites were rare but seasoned well, the hot wings sauce was interesting & not in a good way, Cesar salad was bland , and the bacon was raw yet burned on the jalapeños , not sure how that happens.
Just ordered love this place good service for delivery good prices excellent just ordered a good Thursday night football foody rice chicken beef yummy
Love them!! Excellent staff, docs, everything!! My dog usually doesn't like strangers and as this was our first visit I was a bit worried, but she never barked or seemed nervous at all!
We got the dinner for three! Fantastic! The ginger beef is soooo good. The sweet and sour pork YUM! So much food for a good price! Definitely recommended! Will be going back

Yummy Chinese buffet served hot and fresh.  Great selection and reasonably priced.  Very friendly owner and staff.  Clean and comfortable setting.  We tried the take-out too, fantastic dishes and speedy order.  We will be coming back lots!

Won a free piercing with the purchase of an Anatometal opal and rose gold flower stud through Ryen's Instagram account. Booking was quick and same day through their easy and user friendly online system. When we got there, the waiting area was spacious and welcoming. A lot of tattoo shops/piercing parlours can have a hard and intimidating atmosphere, but Human Kanvas was clean and modern and seemed more like a trendy retail store than your stereotypical tattoo parlour.

The girl at the front desk was an absolute gem - my one year old son had a love affair with her, and she was so friendly and super helpful; I'm only sorry I never grabbed her name.
