The price was a bit more than other pizza places but it's SERIOUSLY worth the increase in price. These guys know how to make pizza and should be adequately compensated for it! 

I have to say that living in Calgary, I thought when I moved out to the Airdrie area I would be losing some of my favourite restaurants and the quality in this small city would never compare to the big city. I have been amazed at what this city has had to offer and I now a new pizza place! 

Having friends over on the weekend and I now know what we are going to be eating.

I live close by and have been there a couple times thinking "maybe this time it won't be so bad...". But each time is worst than the previous. 

Went on wing night, ordered 3 different flavours. The sauce was alright the wings on the other hand was either burnt or undercooked. The entire menu is over priced for the quality. 

Staff is mediocre at best. Mostly hired not for their resume but for what they look like in the "uniform". 

Generally unprofessional, Unhygienic and unimpressed.

We stopped in while waiting for our son's flight to arrive in Calgary. The owners are extremely nice. Emanuele cooked us a pizza that was as good as the ones we had in Naples, Italy. In addition, I purchased products to make sauce and they gave me detailed instructions. Nyla shared fresh almonds with us and showed us how to eat them. They are starting cooking classes soon and I just wish I lived close enough to go! Best wishes to this new business!

Ordered for delivery at work on Main St. Had two larges between 4 people, had a couple slices left over. I dont remember the type of pizzas, but they werent greasy like pizza hut, more similar to BPs. Was about $50 for the two so its definately not cheap.

Delivery was quick

They used to be good, but I'm not at all impressed with my last trip though. The guys seemed more concerned about smoke breaks than moving the line of people waiting. I very clearly explained that I am growing out my hair and just wanted a little trim, after there was about 3" too much cut off he tells me that he doesn't speak English!!! I'm not at all happy that its going to take about 4 months to grow it back to where it was. I won't be returning
What can I say it's Starbucks! Awsome Fraps, Cake Pops and the tea with lemonade is second to non!!!!!
On the weekend we ordered one large pizza of each Sophie's Special and the sweet chili chicken. I love both of these pizzas. They were hot, not greasy and very delicious.

The staff is friendly and the food is good. A popular place with the high school kids at lunch time.  The atmosphere is somewhat lacking and appropriate for the industrial area near where it is located rather than as a restaurant.

After hearing my coworkers RAVE about this place, I know I needed to try this place out. Although there's a Sophie's Pizza in Calgary, the Airdrie location worked out better as I was already in the area for another appointment.

I called beforehand to order so that I would be able to pick up the pizzas right after my appointment. Unfortunately, they had a system issue and had lost my order. The woman who spoke to me was very apologetic and even offered an additional 15% off. I really appreciated that they owned up to their mistake and put an effort in making it up to me. Luckily, I only had to wait 15 mins or so.

I can totally see why my coworkers love this place. To describe it, it's like a better version of Chicago deep dish pizza. It's toppings were of good quality and everything was put together nicely. The crust was thick albeit still tasty. And although this pizza definitely wasn't a healthy choice, it wasn't drenched in a pool of grease/oil like most fast food pizza joints are usually known for. We ordered the Royale and the Beefed Up. Both were delicious, but I preferred the Beefed Up over the Royale.

Sophie's Pizza lands itself as a "premium" fast food pizza choice with its expensive price tag, but it's good to know that if you order a medium or large pizza, you can get the second one for 50% off. I'll definitely return, but it'll have to be spaced out.

We drove to Airdie to meet up with some friends to try this place out. There were 5 of us and we were able to get a table. Quite busy on a Mon night and a very cold night at that! 

Casual atmosphere, decent service but the pub is very new and no doubt has some kinks to work out (no drink specials yet on menu we were told by wait staff). 

The food was ok, none of our party was blown away by anything.

Ordered was:
Salad (greens)
Salmon Fish and Chips
Pub Burger
California Chicken Club
Pulled pork sandwich

Portions were alright, prices on par with Calgary standards.

The place can get loud as most pubs do so be prepared! Not really a place for kids in the evening. (rowdyness, swearing)

30 beer on tap.

Each night has a food special. Tues is half off pizza night and we were all in agreement that this is the only time we would return here - to try that out.

Really wonderful coconut shrimp and fish and chips! Didn't like the lemongrass Caesar. Service lacked at first until the manager started serving us. Would go again for the food and fairly quiet atmosphere.
Disgusting over priced !!wouldnt feed it to a dog !

I grew up in small towns, and any time we went to visit my grandma for a weekend, I remember asking for a few bucks so that I could go see a movie at the small theatre in town. It was my first foray into independence because I was allowed to walk down the alley and through the neighbor's yard to get there on my own, and I have a ton of great memories of watching all sorts of shows there in the 90s. They've upgraded it since, and I still go at times, so this is where I get my perspective when I talk about The Roxy. 

The Roxy is Airdrie's little hometown cinema. Boasting a whole two screens, this Landmark theatre typically runs at least one family-friendly show. The prices are great, considering the next closest option at CrossIron Mills is likely to run you over $40 for two movies and snacks, this can make for a cheap date night, a good way to get out of the house, or a fun and affordable family movie night. 

Don't expect a ton of extras here - you get your typical movie snacks (which, as usual, are a bit overpriced), a simple projection screen, and a decent sound system. I've watched some pretty good action movies here, and I wasn't disappointed at all - the sound was big enough for the room, clear, and not distorted. The pictures were clear and everything was sync'd up well, which is more than I can say for some much more expensive movies  I've seen at other places. 

The Roxy also still has a cheap night, which is Tuesdays, so it can get busier. It's never as crazy as the Calgary theatres, so I'm not afraid  to stop by even then. In addition, if you choose to get on the email list, you'll be treated to loads of offers, from reduced snack prices  and early showing to BOGOs and discounts on tickets. If you're a movie buff, it's worth the once-a-week email.

Final verdict? If you live nearby, just try it out on a movie you're on the fence about - you won't lose a lot of money to see it, and you'll get to see how the theatre is the perfect addition to the smaller town. I'm sure you'll be back.

We tried to come here for lunch on a Saturday with our one month old daughter since it says it's a restaurant and were kicked out because they don't allow anyone under 18 including babies... how can you call yourself a restaurant  AND bar... be real just say you are a bar and put the proper signage up+

And I'm hooked.  First ordered here on the recommendation of a co-worker.  I moved to Airdrie and was disappointed with the lack of good Pizza.  Generally for 2 people we will order 2 mediums taking advantage of a commonly run second pizza half off offer.  General order is the House Special and the Triple Meat.  The magic is in the crust, and the fresh toppings, and the points, and well....... everything.  Pick up is usually 15 - 20 minutes.  I usually pick up to collect the reward points.  If you have never ordered pizza from Sophie's and you are considering it DO IT!!!!!!!!!  

They also have a location in south Calgary.
Love the pho and the vermicelli bowls. The spring rolls are also wonderful. Very tasty and great prices. Fast and friendly service.

The food is great and does not feel frozen. They prepare it every morning. The staff is great and welcoming. The only thing I don't really like about them is their chicken wings. Just like the waitress said the are been cooked in the morning and then warmed up again and that's why they are so dry. Gotta try the salmon fish, it's really good.

By far the worst service I've ever received. It took almost 20 minutes to receive our drinks after we ordered them. When we finally got them, they were delivered by a different waitress.  Took another 10 minutes before our waitress came back to take our food order and almost 40 minutes after that until we got out food. My appetizer came after the rest of my food and we were never checked on during our meal. Then our waitress brought our bills before we were even done eating. Even though she asked who was together at the beginning, she brought all separate bills and all our bills were wrong. The food was alright but definitely not worth waiting almost an hour for along with the several other inconveniences.

You said it zoey!! Absolutely disgusting! Waaay over priced! They shut off the deep fryers for our food because they wanted to stop serving food! Everything was undercooked and full of fryer grease because they were cooked at too low of temperature. The only thing decent was the drinks and even those stopped coming before we were even done the food! They wanted us to leave ASAP! Get out of there so they could stop serving a "diner". This phoney Toad'n'Turtle is a bunch of crock! I actually watched a waitress hike her skirt up through the evening as she probably got the 5-9 shift! It took 3 hours to be served an appetizer and main, a complete waste of time and money! I doubt they would pass a food inspection! I'm actually repulsed thinking about this place! All their "special menu" items are completely fake, nothings actually a deal! Worst place in Airdrie! 

Also Allison below here is a fake hired yelp reviewer that they paid to comment nicely on their page! Look how many times she reviewed places, nobody does that unless they were paid to! And notice how negative is "sandwiched" between 2 positives, she did that on purpose. A classic marketing expense to boost up their reviews so people might check it out.

I would never subject my kids to the torture of Dr. Kular again. She "forgot" to prescribe antibiotics prior to a root canal (her own admission), so my three year old's infected nerve wasn't affected by the freezing, she then attempted to send us home without any protection over the exposed infected nerve and said that she was not in pain and just didn't like the taste. 

Apparently this so-called Doctor believes that screaming/crying for ten minutes, dry heaving because she was crying so hard, and ripping at her face means she doesn't like the taste of a fillant being shoved into her exposed and infected root.

My poor three year old was told to "stop crying, you're scaring the other patients" and on top of everything else.... they prescribed her penicillin - which she is allergic to. I was also given a promise of an "emergency referral" to fix everything they did - never happened either.

Complained to the clinic manager who didn't even apologize, defended the Dr's actions, and called in the "right" prescription for me... without a dosage. 

NEVER EVER AGAIN. A formal complaint has already been submitted.

Once again I went for my favourite Vietnamese dish, Beef Sate which is number 31 at East Lake. The menu "warns" it's spicy but I really don't agree. However, the clear broth has a really nice flavour, rich in aromatics and beefy goodness.

The menu looked extensive as you'd expect and the service is prompt and very friendly. No visa under $15 or debt under $5. Prices are reasonable but servings are a bit smaller than most other places. 

Is like to say I want to return to try other items but I know for me, it's number 31.

Don't go there to watch CFL playoffs or grey cup. 12 TVs and they would only put it on the little tv in the far corner. Would not put it on any other TVs even when I asked. Management not stamps fans at toad and turtle I guess

Delicious Vietnamese. The did here has a wonderful balance of spice, savory, sweet that I haven't had anywhere else. The beef is a better cut than midst places in Calgary, it could actually be a main and not part of larger dish. 

The young coconut was delicious with large pieces of coconut. 

2nd time here in two days and I'll be back.
Come down, grab a seat, and enjoy a pint. A relaxed atmosphere with a wide selection of beers on tap and cocktails created in house.
I enjoyed the peanut butter milkshake!! To die for! The Hawaiian burger is amazing.

Had a great time playing Name That Tune!  Great staff and they were super cool even though we were super loud.  The food was pretty good too..I have Chicken Souvlaki and Greek Salad..which is something you wouldn't normally order in a bar and it was actually pretty decent.

As Monday to Friday'ers what a rare luxury to go for a late lunch with my Hubs on a Friday! It really is too bad that our server (clerk 61) was more interested in visiting with her colleagues than pay proper attention to her tables (or at least, us). 

My steak was over done and my fries were under done (not that I was asked). I wasn't even done eating when she came over with the bill and the machine and just stood there waiting for payment. My Hubs asked for a couple of minutes to pay the bill so I could at least swallow my last bite. 

And then we were abandoned... You wonder how I know her 'clerk id' number? I had to process my own payment on the machine the server left at our table and consulted my bill to gain access because we waited so long for her to come back. 

Too bad, we typically enjoy this place.
Good barber to visit in airdrie. Hardley ever a lineup. Good service. Good haircut. Difficult to find, hidden behind the gas station but good hours and friendly staff.

The new menu is actually really good, If you haven't been to OJ's for a few years its worth another shot.  I wasn't a fan of the old menu it was all fried and greasy.  The new menu is actually really good!  I'll be going back!
New ownership. Service is terrible now. The counter staff doesn't take orders correctly. The owner takes no responsibility. The word "sorry" doesn't seem to exist in this place.

Oh gosh I love Menchie's! I tried it for the first time (I know, what an alien) and I didn't know what to expect in all honesty. I decided to go for the cake batter mixed with fruit cereal (tasted like fruit loops), then I topped it off with graham crumbs, big ole chunks of Reese's Pieces, gummy bears, and cereal. It was amazing. Greatest combination, so I got lucky on that one. Highly recommended if you're down for dessert on a nice summer day!

Btw, the environment is really cute and the mascot is too! Had a good first experience!

Despite the poor reviews I thought I would give this place a try...  It was good but nothing super special. I ordered a basic burger and fries. The prices aren't "fast food" prices, but really aren't crazy as suggested by other reviewers. The burger was fresh and seasoned just right with a soft tasty bun and adequate toppings. The fries were ok... similar to Five Guys... The kind where you eat every single one in the container but then afterwards you wonder if they were worth all the calories :). Theres a good atmosphere (Saturday afternoon) and staff was friendly. I'll be back.
Their choice of flavours is so poor I wouldn't eat any of the crap flavours they had . So overpriced yuck !

Meh...
I know yelp doesn't allow title's on reviews but that would be mine. I had not been their in a while and was in the area last night for a little mid week dinner out. 

Let's start off with the good things: 
- The restaurant seemed really clean. The tables were nicely wiped down with no weird film on them (as some tables at pubs tend to get). Every tables was neatly set up and waiting for guests. 
- The uniforms on the waitress were not too revealing and the seemed to be allowed to wear comfortable shoes. I know this is not a big deal for some people but it is for me. I don't like how some pubs have their waitress showing WAAYYY too much skin on top or on the bottom. I can't you how many times a hard working waitress has been just performing the regular functions on her job and I have seen a pantie or some boobage pop out of their 'uniform' (or lack there of), none of which is appropriate in a workplace. I also hate those restaurants that have their waitresses dress in super high heels while running their feet off and standing for long hours. I know those waitresses would never complain but as a patron I can tell your are in pain and I hate seeing it (jumping down from my soap box now).
- They have a decent sized menu. There seems to be something for everyone so I could see how the place would be really inclusive to all food tastes. 

Some of the not so good things:
- I found the food to be sorta pricey. Every plate was at least $14 for items that are less expensive at other pubs. My husband partook in the evening special which was a vegetarian pizza which was half off (that was a good deal) but the menu said it would be an 8 inch pizza and when it arrive it was 6 inches at best. I suppose maybe they 'measure' the pizza before it goes in the oven and then it's 8 inches or because it's on special it's smaller but if you were paying the full price, that pizza would be expensive for what you got. Don't get me wrong it was a tasty pizza but not worth the full price tag only worth the half off. 
-The food was just okay for the higher price tag. I had the Yorkies and I am a HUGE fan of Yorkshire pudding and these were good (my momma still makes the best thought.... SHOUT OUT TO MA!) but the roast beef was a little dry and the gravy was pretty salty and unidentifiably lumpy.  However, I just scraped that gravy off and enjoyed my plate of food, it just seemed expensive for what I got though. 
- I found the drink specials to be not that special, the Tuesday night beer special was really only $1.00 off the smallest one, $0.75 off the medium one and $0.25 off the largest one. I get it you are discounting beer and you don't want to be throwing profits away but come on, offer a better incentive and maybe it would be fuller in the restaurant. 
- The service was kinda slow to begin with. I hesitate to mention this as our waitress admitted that she was new (but in later conversation with her she said that she was there a month which is new-ish and makes me feel slightly better about mentioning this). We waited almost 20 minutes to get our menus. Not so much as a 'Hi, I'll be right with you' or an apology for the wait. She spent a lot of time chatting up the tables of men that were also assigned to her section. The place was also not really that busy so I wonder how service would be should it have been busier.

LASTLY, the down right unacceptable:
- They charge for refills on pop. WHAT?!?!?! Is it 1991? Have we stepped back into the past? Can we smoke now in this bar? Is Brian Mulroney Prime Minister? Is Ralph Klein the premier? I am sure that the menu mentions it, but, because its not 1991, I didn't even look to see if the pop was bottomless. So imagine my shock, when I received my bill and was not only charged $3.25 for a pop (which we all know cost less than a $0.25 and it was half ice) but I was charged an extra $1.00 for each refill. I was charged almost as much as a beer! If I would have had a beer, I probably would have received more actual liquid (on account of the pop being mostly ice). When we brought this to our waitresses attention she mentioned that she had just worked there a month and this was the first time she has noticed the charge. 

I know I probably won't be back to this restaurant as I felt super nickle and dimmed at this place. It wasn't that great that I can over look the feel of paying too much for what I got.

Excellent Staff, Dr. Denson & Dr. Moradian have been wonderful with my whole family! My kids feel very comfortable going there and they take the time to explain everything to them so they aren't scared.  Beautiful office & nice selection of frames and sunglasses.  Their hours are nice as well, being open a bit later some evenings.

I took our Acura in to have a "SRS" light checked. I was told that it just needed to be reset. Cost $130.00. Oh well. 2 days later the light came back on. I went back and this time I was told that it would cost $430.00 for  a new sensor. I asked what I had paid $130.00 for. "A diagnosis", I was told. Some diagnosis

Sophie's used to be our very favourite go to pizza joint in Airdrie until we found hair in our chicken wings and when we complained she told us to deal with it, it's the supplier not the restaurant. Will never ever recommend Sophie's to anyone
Responded to a complaint about her unprofessional behavior by contacting other dentists and telling them she had fired our family as clients.

Went here for dessert with hubby.  You get to serve yourself from 16 different soft yogurt types (red velvet cake and cake batter were yummy). The selection of yogurt flavours changes.  Add your toppings - candy, chocolate, fruit, coconut, tons to choose from! . You pay by the weight of what you order. Was reasonably priced. Great staff.  Will definitely bring the kids here.   The store is very nice, love the decor and the way it's set up!   Make sure you get a loyalty card to gain points towards free yogurt!

Not a big fan.  Found that most of their yogurt flavors tasted bland or fake.  The pineapple was probably the best, reminded me of Dole Whips that you can get in Hawaii.  Price is decent for the amount, but wish their product tasted better.
I ordered the fish tacos and they came out cold while everyone else's food was hot. Nice server and mediocre food.

Disappointing experience. Went in on opening morning at 11:30. Ordered a chocolate shake and an avocado bacon burger. The shake was promptly delivered to my table. Small and watery for $5.49. A few mins later my burger arrived. Looks quite plain on the large tray without fries, and I would expect more do the over $15 I spent on a quick lunch. 

Burger was ok. Lots of avocado, but disappointed with the rubbery texture of the two quite small beef patties. ($9.49 for a double burger, $7.49 for single patty)

As I was eating all the school kids from across the street piled in, huge line and terribly loud. Hopefully they have success with the school age population as my odds of returning are low.

The Good: Friendly staff. Food was good quality and well prepared. Clean environment. Nice atmosphere. Staff was willing to accommodate a mess up.

The Bad: I received the wrong order. What I ordered (bison burger) was served to another customer somehow. The wrong meal was on the house which was acceptable. Anyways, they did say I'd get the right order "to go" on my way out.

The Ugly: I never received my bison burger.

The pho was good, broth was flavourful! One of the better places I've tried since moving to Calgary over a year ago. (I had the rare beef pho with sate and veggie salad rolls.)

The menu options are average, but better than the last place I tried. Service was great. I will definitely be back!

i've been boycotting OJ's for a while now because a couple years ago i got food poisoning (at a different location!!!) but man. a friend convinced me to just shut up and give this place a shot and i can not get enough! affordable and delicious with a wide variety of choices for food and bevvies! awesome staff also. i always tip extra well here. love getting the gyoza and fish tacos! yum yum. keep it up ojs

What an awesome little find.  I hope they hurry and build a location in Calgary since according to their website they do not have one here yet.

Following a recent dinner with the kids in Airdrie we noticed this little place called Menchie's and something to do with frozen yogurt.  Since they behaved during dinner I decided a treat was in order.  We stopped in and it was bustling.  The friendly staff immediately explained how it works and we were hooked.  Before you decide on your flavours you are welcome to try as many samples as you wish.  All self serve. 

The process goes as follows: take your bowl, pick a yogurt flavour, stick with that flavour or blend it with another.  Next choose toppings from the large selection, sauces, the works.  Make it as big or little as you want.  You pay by weight.  For 3 of us our treats came to $9 - Fantastico!!

Liked their yogurt selection and later when I looked online I noticed they must have over 100 yogurt flavour combinations.  Here's hoping they offer these new flavours on a regular basis.  

I further enjoyed reading on their website they are certified Kosher, gluten-free, vegan, and have no high fructose corn syrup options in their products.  They gave us a customer reward card and while my immediate reaction was oh great another card to pack around I decided it would be a good thing to have because I'm certain we will be back.

We visit here a quite few times and find something wrong sometimes, but basically OK.
Foods are good, staffs are fine as usual. Sometimes we needed to ask a new drink because cups have lip mark.. needed to ask new fries because they were too hard to chew. Sometimes they made us wait like 10 minutes without menu or asking drinks. not a bad place though. probably depends on how busy they are or who serves you

Good pizza, with a very nice crust.  Ordered a large triple meat and there was no shortage of toppings which is what I want from a pizza, but seriously...$35 for a "large" pizza and 2L of pop? The "large" is a 12" diameter which at any other place I've ordered from in my life is called a medium!

Like I said, good pizza but so not worth the ultra premium price tag

Toad n Turtle has gotten a lot better since I first tested it out. 

Service is friendlier, and faster. I only seem to visit on wing nights now, but even when it's that busy I still feel welcomed. The only complaint I have since I started goof more frequently is that, on more than one occasion, the glass my drink had come in was dirty. I once even got a glass with someone else's lip imprint on the rim. Ew! The server fixed it right away but not something that should occur in a clean place.

I also wish they had a bit more selection on their patio and the tables weren't as squished together. Either way, they've improved!
Dont show up on time for this class because they wont let you in once the teacher has entered. The girl running the front desk isn't very customer service oriented either.

We've eaten here a few times, sadly some of our favourites are gone in favour of a summer menu that isn't as appealing to us.  Our last visit was a quick lunch while D was working and I had the day off.

He had the BBQ Brisket Sandwich with fries and gravy, and I had the Steak n Prawns special with fries and a side of gravy as well.  I also tried the elderflower cider, which was delicious but very unusual in flavour so D didn't like it but I found it unique and worth trying again.

The Steak was a little over for me, I like mine medium rare and bordering on rare but it was closer to medium.  Still the seasoning was great and the fries were good, especially with the nice thick gravy.  The prawns were fresh, but it would have been nice to have a few more of them.

We'll be going back but probably not too often until the next menu change.

I was a little disappointed in this location, compared to ones I have been in Calgary. I came with my mom for a mommy/daughter day, and it was crazy busy. It was Friday at lunch, so that was to be expected. 

Our server was really slow, and took a long time to even get waters. I had to ask for the GF menu, which took another insane amount of time. We were finally able to order our food, which came out pretty quick considering how busy it was and the slow service. 

My burger (patty, no bun) was super salty, I think I ate maybe half and couldn't finish, it was too much. Fries and slaw were good though. As well, my raspberry mojito. 

My mom had curry bowl and said it was good. I know we'll go back as they do cater to GF and it's close to my parents house. I was just disappointed this round.

I use to get take out from East Lake all the time, they were by far the best Vietnamese restaurant in airdrie. 

Unfortunately, they have recently changed their take out portions. They are now half of what they use to be and what every other Vietnamese restaurant I have ever ordered from uses. It would have been fine, but they haven't changed the prices to reflect the portion change.

I ordered vermicelli and for the first time in my life I have actually finished my plate and was left wanting more. Half the pint size container was wilt lettuce, very disappointed that I have paid full price for half a meal. 

Otherwise food was good, quality for take out has dropped. Guess I will be exploring the other Vietnamese restaurant available in airdrie from now on.

Out of the 3 Starbucks in Airdrie, I'd say this one is the worst. It's hard to get in and out of it and the staff don't provide a great customer experience. Also they always put too much coffee into a light drink.

Nice atmosphere, waitress was very nice.  Hubby and I were here for our date night.  I wanted to try drinking beer, as I usually don't like beer, so the waitress brought me a sample to try before I ordered a big glass.  Had the Alley Kat Aprikat beer, which was super delicious!  I highly recommend it!

We shared the Red Tractor nachos with spicy beef on them.  They arrived in a huge basket with the perfect amount of cheese and other toppings.  We couldn't finish the whole thing, it was quite a big portion!  I'm glad that we shared it lol.

We'd come back here for sure, especially on a hot day when we can sit on the patio :)

I came here to visit with family from out of town. welcoming atmosphere, low music in the dining room so we could still talk, and good food. The types of comfort food you'd expect to find on a pub/sports bar menu.

Overall i would go again and would also recommend this restaurant.

Not a great burger, mediocre fries, long waits. 

For my money is rather go to Five Guys for a better burger and fries. 

It's not a staff issue, I guess I just don't like this chain and their food.
Stopped on our way to Cranbrook BC from Edmonton.  Decently fast service considering it is lunch time.  Lots of beer on tap from local Alberta brewers.  Good menu with traditional comfort pub food.

Usually ok however tonight the service was slow. Had to ask if we had a waitress. Usually after they say sorry for the wait everything goes ok but not tonight.
Slow throughout. Not sure if I want to go back.

I've been going to Bogey's for years.  Yes, it's still a dive bar.  Yes, it's still loud on busy nights or when there is a game on.  Yes, it's still fantastic.  

The service has been above average every time I've gone.  Even on busy nights it has still been better than most comparable pubs.

The best part of Bogey's is the food for sure.   The amount of bad meals I've had at Bogey's in 15+ years I can count on one hand.  I've had probably everything on the menu at this point and it's all great.
This place is great, especially for those who are allergic to dairy and gluten. Really great food and awesome staff. Thank you!

Absolutely amazing!! 

The best pho I've ever had, the broth is so flavourful and the staff is So accommodating!

My Fiancé is on a Keto diet right now and ordering food is always brutal, but Pho East Lake was AMAZING about it! I didn't want to over complicate it too much and I always feel bad but I was blown away by The lady on the phone as she was simply incredible!

The best customer service I've ever had at ANY restaurant and the Best pho, oh my god and their subs, they are so good too. I've never been disappointed

Keep it up! And thank you Pho East Lake!
A really yummy place for all ages ! Tons of favors and toppings

So good!!! We always order the Hawaiian pizza which is weird because we never get Hawaiian but it is really good here. It isn't greasy like other places and the cheese tastes real :p it is pretty pricey but every once in awhile when you just want a good satisfying pizza then this is the place. 
We order a medium (about 17.00) between the two of us and it's the perfect size.

Went here for the first time a few weeks ago on a date. I dont know what was worse the date or the ice cream.

Neither of us had been before so we asked the less than helpful young lady what the process was, she didnt seem to inclined to help. We fumbled around and made a mess, but something worth eating. Tried a few flavors in the same cup and they tasted bland.

Store was dirty in general, we had to push someone elses refuse to the side on a table so we could sit. 

If I could do it all over again I would just grab ice cream from the store or convenience store and find a park to sit in.

This theatre doesn't have all the bells and whistles of the bigger ones in Calgary,  but it serves it's purpose.  It is not as expensive as the others at $8 per adult.  It is never busy.  I have gone to see some blockbusters on opening day and there was no line up and there were plenty of seats.  Worth the short drive from Calgary to go.

Great Options for wing Wednesday

Busy and a little loud but it's a pub 

I'll be back

First off, OH THE MILKSHAKES ARE SO GOOD
But the Burgers or only ok, I would rate it a 4, but I wasnt really blown away. I mean its worth trying but not worth tracking across the city for

We have been waiting for the day we could try what we thought could potentially be a little gem close to our house. That day was yesterday and well, we were more than a little disappointed. 

First impressions are good with the place being new, clean and quite cute inside. But... you know what they say about 'lipstick'. 

We got a huge shock when we ordered since we paid almost $30 for two 'classic' burgers (their most basic burger), shared chili cheese fries and a shared drink. What??? This is still fast food, right? At this price we were really hoping for some great food. Nope. 

My burger was dry and the bun was saturated with some sort of 'secret' sauce (they should probably keep this secret to themselves). I was going to take it back but my Hubs offered to switch with me. The chili cheese fries were bland and tasteless with the cheese looking like someone boiled 'no name' cheese slices in water.

The most intelligent thing the owners have done is set up business across from the high school. Kids don't care if they are getting snowed, can't tell quality and need a place to loiter.

Just an FYI, this is a chain fast food restaurant not a locally owned place as we had assumed.

Being forced to go for "Fro-Yo" by a few ladies in my life, I made the drive out to Menchies twice this past weekend. First day, I had the Vanilla wiyj some chocolate bar toppings which was okay. The next day I had the Red Velvet and Cake Batter swirl and they were pretty amazing. I'm not a huge fan of sweets, but I enjoyed my experience.

I can see why it's on the downhill slide. Food has gone to the seagulls, drink prices have gone up. We booked the "private room" to show up and have others in there with football blaring. I think management has lost touch with what the bedroom community wants. I'll head to the brewhouse next time.....

Recently I have been annoyed with the barber I was seeing on Main St in Airdrie, he was never open on time in the morning.

Found that KingsView is within walking distance of my house. Decided to drop in and see if he had the hands of a wizard god. 

New and clean store without any funky music playing. Straight up barber shop for the regular guy!!

Good haircut, and he was very polite. Only charged me half price as it was a deal to draw customers during the first few months of opening. Gave him the full price as I was happy with the service.

10 am in Airdrie. This Good Earth felt like mommy central. There was a group of them in the corner, another one at the table beside me... and then one other guy seated in the corner. 

Girls behind the counter were lovely, saying hello to me on my way in. My coffee and breakfast bagel were on par with other Good Earth locations.

What else can I say? Good Earth is becoming a pretty common coffee shop to find in most major neighbourhoods round these parts. This one seems to be meetin' my GE expectations.

Wow...just wow. Terrible service this morning. Incredibly slow service at the drive thru. This is a huge corporate empire that SPECIALIZES in coffee. MY drink was not made as requested and it isn't like I asked for something out of the ordinary.  
Tried the new egg bites and I found those to be fairly good.

Easily the best place to grab a coffee in Airdrie, but holy moly their prices just keep getting higher and higher to the point where I just can't give them more than three stars despite their high quality drinks & food and their great staff. My go-to summertime drink for the past few years - the banana latte frappe, which is a delicious and not too sweet blend of coffee and a real banana - actually got into cost-prohibitive territory for me this year, with a large costing over $7.

I've had a lot of bad experiences with other Good Earth cafés around the Calgary area, but I have to say that this one is consistently the best I've been to. 

I like their stuff, and I'll absolutely be back, but I don't think I'll be getting anything more extravagant than a small latte.

Its 6:00AM and I'm very tired but need to be in Edmonton by 9:00.  Got outa Calgary early and have the GPS homed in on this Starbucks.  But I'll be damned if its pointed to a nonexistent address .... circle around the block and see a Timmy Hortons sign.  Pull in front and, my god!  Drive-thru lineup at least 10 cars deep, spilling out to the street.  Line out the door.  No way am I waiting in that line for a watered down coffee and gooey portable breakfast.  But if this place is packed, the Starbucks will probably be too. 

With dumb luck, I see over to the left the sign for Seattle coffee addicts fix.  I speed over and am delighted to see no cars in the drive-thru,  I go inside and its empty,  Get my latte and bag of cashews for breakfast.  Service was snappy, and the latte hit the spot.  

In retrospect its nice to see the locals stick to what works for them.  Thankfully for out of towners, this makes access to our staples a little less hectic.

My favourite Vietnamese place in Western Canada and I have had most, if not all of their dishes over the years.

My only complaint is their habit of laying both the radio and TV, which is awful. Please pick one or, better yet,let us have some peace and quiet.

These Guys are Incredible!
I went in to book an appointment about 3 months ago, After years of neglect and avoiding a Dentist the time finally came to ' get a check up '.

I look up reviews online for Airdrie Dentists and Sierra Springs kept coming up as a top rated Clinic.

Upon arriving I was greeted with some of the friendliest people I've ever met, they made me feel welcome, chit-chatted about life with me, and did an amazing clean on all of my teeth.

*Update*
I just went back for an emergency removal of a wire in my teeth from about 15 years ago, they rushed me in, made me feel at home, and fixed the wire up.

Solantra and her team are awesome, if you are looking for an amazing dental clinic give these guys a try!

Beer Good! Food Good! Waitress fast!
I am a man of few words

This is one of my go to lunch places in Airdrie. It's pretty authentic Vietnamese food (not Westernized like most places), quick and best bang for you buck. And it also gets very busy, so that says a lot about this place. You have your choices of traditional dishes: pho, vermicelli with spring rolls, pork & rice - all of these get a thumbs up from me, so you can't go wrong with whatever you choose.

Their food never is a disappointment. Staff is super friendly. Potato bacon soup is divine! Can be noisy. But at least it's not full of screaming kids. Wait time on Friday was 20 minutes, not to horrible. Will definitely come back

My wife and I really enjoy going to this location the majority of the time, with exception to friday nights or late night as the crowd is typically the young, dumb and drunk. Aside from this, the other concern is that the smokers hang out by the front door so you have to walk through a cloud of smoke at times to enter the establishment.

Food is quite good most of the time, there has been times where the B Shift in the kitchen must be on as the quality is just not quite the same.

Service has always been good, friendly and familier.

Very slow service. Karaoke was late starting due to not being prepared for a new system. We asked for our bill and it took forever to get it and she never came back to take out payment. We ended up having to pay cash at the bar.
Friendly staff and exceptional customer service. I went in to grab a venti iced caramel macchiato and the cafe looked really clean. I would go back to this location very often.

Beautiful studio. Excellent teachers..but unprofessional:( we have been going for just over a year now and the teacher that normally teaches a class shafted us and ended up shadowing another student while she practiced along side us no introduction of any kind and we all felt awkward and disappointed. Asking to speak to the Manager and or comments in their box they don't care enough to call you back. Wouldn't recommend if you want a consistent studio with professional teachers.

Stopped for dinner on our way back to Edmonton this week. Will never visit again. 

We didn't get menus and when our waitress came over to ask if we'd decided what we wanted, I said we weren't sure as we still hadn't received menus (that we asked for when she brought our drinks). She brought them and we ordered wings to start. The waitress then decided it was a good idea to comment that "if you just wanted wings they're in the drinks menu, I didn't have to bring you a dinner menu".... not impressed. That should have been communicated to us and she should have kept her snide comment to herself. 

Ordered salt & pepper wings that were way over seasoned. I coughed each bite I took because of the drastic amount of salt. After getting our wings we ordered dinner - a spinach salad and a cheeseburger wrap. The salad was $14 and was the size of a starter. 4 pieces of spinach deep and drowning in balsamic vinegar. It was a terrible. My lips were raw by the time I left because of the amount of salt and balsamic on the food.

I should have stopped ANYWHERE else and would have been much more satisfied and would have saved money. If I hadn't been incredibly hungry, I would have stopped eating after a couple wings. 
Terrible experience. The waitress was definitely not hired for her customer service or intelligence.
Best Vietnamese restaurant in Alberta, without a doubt. Epic, fresh food and very friendly atmosphere. Highly recommended!

They've gotten me in immediately despite because backed up. Staff have a sense of humour and are also professional. However a couple staff are rude and don't follow proper procedures. When I brought in a tire I bought from that store that was flat, they refused to patch it. I come back a week later, they fix it no questions asked.

Pizza is really good (Greek style).  Definitely look for the take out specials, as it's a much better value, and you can save the $5 delivery charge (that I wasn't informed of before my first delivery).  Appetizers are also very tasty - particularly the meatballs and the teriyaki ribs.

This place is sooo good and fun to grab a nice refreshing treat!
I am so glad we now have a self-serve yogurt place in Alberta similar to the States.

Just moved to Airdrie, read the previous review and thought I'd give this place a shot. Very happy with the cut I received. The shop was clean, relaxed, and both people working there were extremely friendly.  The barber took their time and made sure I was happy with the cut throughout the whole process.
Price for the cut was $18 + tip, very reasonable for a solid cut. I'll definitely be going back.

The Roxy theatre used to have its place with inexpensive admission and really good prices for popcorn and snacks. It was my go to theatre to get away from crowds and a cheap night out at the theatre with the kids. Whether living in Airdrie or driving in from Calgary, it was a safe bet for a good experience.

Fast forward to current day experience. I admit, it's been awhile since i attended the Roxy, so I was pretty surprised the ticket prices were slightly less then Landmark Calgary. But that's the best it will get. The food prices are insane for a low end movie theatre....it's the same prices as landmark Calgary. Seats are old, dirty, and on their last leg. Entire theatre is outdated and your typical small town theatre. Except someone missed the memo...prices are too high.  

Why on earth would anyone go to Roxy and pay the same prices as Calgary Landmark when they can go to a state of the art Landmark 16 and get reclining seats, awesome soda machines, new everything and well worth the money. 

Tuesday's are cheaper but crowded...no different then cheap Tuesday in Calgary, so might as well order tickets online and drive to Calgary. 

Anyways, I was disappointed and surprised with the prices and paid $30 for their 2 popcorn and drink combo.

P32 Shrimp sate on rice noodle soup is absolutely amazing. 

Beautiful tasting broth.

Guess I shouldn't have went in winter because there was only 4-6 flavours available and of that, they all came out liquid. Two flavours didn't work at all. The gummy's were rock hard. Generally a horrible experience - the cashier wasn't even in the front for a good 5 minutes after we walked it. Barely even greeted us. Stayed at the til looking at her nails. 

Wont be returning - very disappointed in quality, service and available options.
Better than many of these reviews state, the food is quite good and the service always very friendly and prompt. You could do much worse in Airdrie.

After a long day of work D and I agreed we were due for a pub night.  He suggested we try this little pub, if it still existed, that he used to frequent back when he lived in Calgary 8 years ago.  So off we drove, got lost, and ended up finding the place in a little corner of Airdrie right where it used to be.

First impressions - I probably wouldn't have thought to go in if he hadn't been with me.  There were people standing outside smoking and the windows were coated in something that gave them a mirror effect so you couldn't see inside to see what the place looks like.  His memory of the food was enough to encourage giving it a try anyway and I'm rather glad we did.

On the inside it's sort-of golf themed, and looks like your typical darkened pub.  We sat down at a table on the end of a column of 3 joined tables, in the quietest corner there.  Right away our server Shelley came by and gave us menus and took a drink order.  He had 2 Heineken bottles over the course of the meal and I had a Strongbow which thankfully came out of a bottle and not a can.  If it's not on tap I prefer the taste of bottled Strongbow, rather than the weak-flavoured metallic canned version.

For food D ordered the pulled pork sandwich with fries and gravy.  The fries were crisp, the gravy rich and thick, and the sandwich I didn't steal a bite of but it was supposedly quite good.  I might try their pulled pork pizza next time.

On the other hand I tried one of their supposedly famous pizza's: the Cheeseburger.  It's one of their top selling pizzas and I can see why.

Crust: the perfect halfway point between thin-crust and pan-style so it was crispy but not overly crunch and had great flavour.
Toppings: there was lots of everything on top, with a great undertone of taco seasoning which worked great!  Lots of ground beef, sauce, cheese, enough that half a pizza was filling even as a 10"!
Leftovers:  Your typical fast-food pizza tastes like cardboard the next day.  Not so with this.  I saved 2 large pieces for lunch the next day and honestly it was almost as good as it was fresh out of the oven.  I probably could have left it in the toaster oven a few more minutes but even then it was delicious on the second day.

The only sad thing is their appetizers seem to be rather expensive for what you get.  I'd have to see a serving size of the deep fried dill pickles before I order one because 4 pcs does not sound like a lot for the cost they're charging.

I would definitely order that pizza again and i will be going back to Bogey's.

Super impressed!  We tried the lasagna bologna, spaghetti bologna and focaccia bread. The spaghetti was my favorite but it was all really good. Best focaccia bread I've ever had. Prices are higher - but the quality shows The owners were lovely. Service was quick.

Good food but not all the things on the menu are "typical" pub fare as I expected. A nice variety of beer and drinks that made sure you never ran out of choices.

Came with a group of four people.
After waiting 25 minutes for a table we ended up being refused service over the fact one of us had a British passport and they said they couldn't confirm the age and whether or not it was legit. (She didn't have a licence and happened to be at the register's office applying for one that morning so she had her passport on her.) So she was forced to go back home and grab her Alberta ID card before we'd be served. 

Once everything was sorted we ordered wings and nachos to share along with four drinks. We were celebrating our last night together as we all met in Airdrie but now live in 4 different cities around AB and BC.

To celebrate we each were going to take a shot, after ordering it took a long time to bring them to us, which wasn't a huge deal since we were chatting. We each got a simple shot that consisted of 1 or 2 liquor and were picked right off of the menu. When we finally got our shots, the waitress said that the bartender told her to inform us that if we were ordering shots for a "big group" we'd all have to order the same shot.

I'd never heard this policy before, especially for a group of four people. Needless to say we didn't order another round. After that happened we were ignored by the waitress for the rest of our stay and had to blatantly go up and ask for the bill after sitting there with empty drinks and plates for over 25 minutes.

I'd come back, but hopefully the staff isn't the same.

This restaurant may seem expensive at first glance, but it is worth every penny!  When I last ordered it was buy 1, get the 2nd one half price.  Once you've tasted the fresh toppings and the homemade crust you will be glad you ordered from here.  They have many interesting choices for toppings and the service is quick and friendly.  I'd definitely recommend it unless you want cheap, "it will do" pizza.

Love this location!  I drive from Calgary just to come here.  The staff is always really friendly, fast and courteous.  Very clean, lots of TV's, no minors, really yummy caesars (rarely found now a days) and the food is always amazing. They make the best Original Joe's french onion soup! Over time I have taken 19 people here and every one has agreed, 5 stars.

We ordered from SkipTheDishes and took so long to confirm order. Skip the dishes couldn't reach them and called me to see if I wanted to wait 5 more minutes or cancel. I chose to wait because we wanted to try this new restaurant and were excited. 
Finally the order was confirmed and delivered. Delivery was fast. 
The food.....not impressed! 
Fettuccini Alfredo: noodles were way over cooked and gummy. Not enough sauce. I could only eat about 5 bites and threw it out. Wasted $18. 
Lasagna: husband said it tasted like it was one of the frozen kinds you buy at Safeway but ate it anyway. Not worth the $22. 
Portions were tiny for the exorbitant prices. If you're going to charge that much for food, you better make sure it's good! 
I totally regret not canceling my order.
Update. We received a full refund. Thanks.

Prices are generally reasonable but access hours are limited & the gate may not open after office hours. Angry customers may line up trying their pass codes to no avail.  Gate locked when scheduled to be open can cost affected customers thousands$$ in extra moving costs. No after office hour service at all. No emergency number to call. Head office has a strict ZERO customer service & satisfaction approach.  Corporate office refuses to acknowledge calls about the gate problems,, etc. If you find yourself locked in the yard expect to be gulagged there till the office re-opens.  Soviet union of storage.

Awful business will never be back. Both my kids have glasses and kept referring me to different eye doctors as they haven't a clue what they are doing . A bunch of incompetent impatient docs. This is not a kid friendly business !!

Saw that the new studio was open, so I popped in. Got chatting with the staff and was super impressed with the deals being offered as well as the super convenient location! Also, staff was very friendly and helpful! Looking forward to taking classes here!!! 

Keep up the great work!

This Starbucks always gives me much to strong to the already strong coffee. Although I've never had an unfriendly staff its usually slow and they don't always know what they are doing. Much better service other places.

Was first of all disappointed to have to pay a deposit to have them order in a frame (what if I don't like it when I try it on?), but was even MORE disappointed that after I bought my glasses, I kept returning and telling them "They are not properly correcting my vision".  They kept saying "You just have to get used to them".  I have worn glasses for 25 years, and while I have previously had to adjust to a new prescription, have never had to adjust to still not having my vision corrected.  Very poor customer service, and I think I have a better chance of vision correction if I make the lenses myself out of mason jars.  Went back to the last place in Calgary that I used (I went to Specs to support local Airdrie business), and voila!!!  After a year of blindness, now I see!!!!

Recently had my tires changed here and it was a positive experience. I first went to another shop and they wanted me to come back the next day to get them changed, and since I was impatient and already out I decided to swing by Kal Tire and they took me in right away and changed, bagged, and returned my tires rather promptly. The gentleman behind the desk seemed kind and the service was competitively priced.

I have been renting storage space at the Airdrie Storage-Mart for 6 years.
Recently the management has changed for the worse.
Monthly fees have been paid with automatic charges to a credit card.
Recently they have buggered up the info on the credit card which I had to visit and get fixed.
This month's fees were not taken by their billing system and last night I was denied access.
I call the emergency toll free number and received no help at all.
The answering person said that he was unable to do anything. I had to visit the management in the morning.
This morning I paid them a visit and asked why the payment was not taken?
He checked the credit card on file, clicked a button and payment was applied.
No errors on their system for my credit card info.
They don't even have the ability to verify their internal systems.
They just lock you out with all the inconveniences that it entails.

He had no idea why that happened and BLAMED ME saying I was responsible.
He never apologized.
So much for 6 years of faithful payments and loyalty
Aside for having our rental fees go up from $150/mnth to $230/mnth.
This is it. I am out of there.
Found a comparable unit a few miles away for close to $100/mnth less

Wings were awesome, beer was good. We came after work and felt a little out of place and kind of like we should have chose the patio. If you don't have any dirt under your fingernails your golden but maybe not the place to meet up with the buddies after a long day.
This place is unreal. I highly recommend the bbq bacon cheddar burger and the sweet potato fries with the chipotle sauce is amazing

The most dishonest dealership we've ever dealt with. My son needed new break pads and he was quoted a price and yet when we went to pick up his car they charged him  more then double he was expecting. We could have got them way cheaper at the local mechanic. Totally took advantage of a kid who thought people were honest. We have been taking this car to 
 Airdrie Honda since we purchased it in 2007. They have seen a ton of service dollars from our wallet but today was THE LAST DOLLAR they will ever see. And to think we have 2 Acura's that we were going to start servicing with them...haha ...not in this lifetime.

Too bad about all the terrible reviews! I've had decent food here several times, we order and pick up. I like the burgers, they are better than average for sure. Their regular poutine is really good! I'm from Quebec, the land of epic poutine, and man Calgary poutine sucks! This place is good though, feels like a little taste of home. 

I wouldn't say it blows me away, hence the 3 star review, but I've never been disappointed. Large portions, fresh food, friendly service, good topping and sauce selection. The patties could be a little thicker, to compete with 5 Guys, but overall it's A ok!

If your looking for some distasteful frozen yogurt menchies Airdrie is the place, horrible customer service older lady working was anything but accommodating was rude and Would NEVER go back. Management was AWFUL.

I am using every opportunity I have to warn fellow RV enthusiasts away from StorageMart. We paid for storage at a location for 9 months. The unit was only there one month of this time. Within that one month, someone with a code for the gates had come in vandalized and robbed our unit resulting in close to $20,000 in damages. We of course have insurance but are out for deductibles, cancelled summer trips for our family, gas bringing the unit back and forth for repairs and our time and anguish dealing with this mess. We asked StorageMart to at least refund our fees but they have refused and apparently have no surveillance footage of this happening which given what happened must have taken close to two hours at least. Stay away if you don't want your belongings damaged or stolen.

Busy, busy, busy! Especially on Wednesday for wing night (upstairs and main floor patios are now closed for the season :-(), but a reliable, quality stand by. Over the summer business calms down a bit, but going into busy season now. Food is always good, staff is great (Craig, the Manager runs around helping out when and where he can) and just a short distance from home. We are here on a fairly regular basis and we haven't had a compliant since they opened.

Like to start off saying how good the service is at this location the male and female at the desk were so helpful and showed me all the units i wanted to see. the downside with the good service... the equipment on site lacks speed, took 25+ minutes to make a debit purchase as the internet kept failing and after getting past this step the computer started acting up so after 35 minuets i finally leave a little upset but the staff tried there best to keep me as a happy customer. I really think management needs to fix issues before myself and other customers start leaving, with all the storage places around this area and all same prices you would think they would be on top of keeping there equipment running top notch

Service 8/10
Speed of service 0/10
Price 5/10


Got a reply from storage mart advised the issue well be fixed soon, i guess i well see next month and then ill see how i change my review.

Thanks for the fast reply management.

What more can I say about Menchie's that everyone else hasn't already said? Inventive, flavourful frozen yogurt. Awesome staff. Awesome little shop. A cornucopia of flavours. Choose your own, mix them up, mix them up some more, top with your choice of toppings, maybe go back and mix in some more--the possibilities are endless! I had to stop myself from unleashing the inner Froyo Iron Chef because the look on the face of my partner in crime was getting to a point where i could see it forming an "ok, you said you'd stop at 6 flavours, this is getting embarrassing now" kind of look.

it's amusing to take a look at the celebrity wall on the inside of the store that's lined with pictures of North American celebs caught in the act of walking around and indulging in Menchie's. A clever marketing campaign and an easy way to increase their cool cache, but to be a truly awesome wall it's still missing one very important picture: Mayor Nenshi munchin' on some Menchie's. Yelpers, we need to make it happen!

Passing through Airdrie on the QE2 and need a pit stop? Pop on over to Starbucks.

Located just off of the QE2, this Starbucks location has become a habitually stop for me. I travel through Airdrie a lot and have grown accustom to stopping into this location to use their bathroom and grab a coffee. This location is always well kept with friendly staff and usually isn't very busy. They know how to make your order and won't mess up your extra-hot-no-foam-soy-sugar-free-10-pump-caffeine-induced-addiction.

Like Starbucks? Then drop by this location on your way through Airdrie.

Probably my favourite place in Airdrie for wing night. Great service, good wings and great company! If your going on on any other night food can be hit or miss but the amazing girls there will always make it right!

''Tis the season of Christmas joy okay okay.  Another great Starbucks experience!!!  Staff here are so friendly, if you frequent this Starbucks the staff begin to know you by name and even know the drink you like.  I surprised them by ordering a juniper latte which was very delicious!  Of course they have other Christmas flavours of coffee or tea as well as yummy goodness.  
They have a mobile order pick up counter which is very convenient for the people in a rush. 
The drive though can be very very busy and may become slow getting through.  I always go in it seems to be quicker service.  Parking is plenty. This Starbucks location is quite roomy.  Located just off the QE2 highway in Airdrie on the east side.  Easy access in and out. 
Well worth a stop, ''tis the season.

Bought my car here which was ok. Found out I got much less of a good deal than I thought I did after all the additional costs got added on. I suppose that's par for the course when buying a car. I got a couple free oil changes out of the deal which I've appreciated but in my most recent maintenance dealings I was charged 2 and 1/2 times the quoted fee for the work that was done. That would be fine if the labour was unexpectedly more difficult or some such thing but that wasn't the case here. The exact fee was quoted upon drop off and then greatly inflated upon payment. I can't say I was terribly impressed. And this was after talking them out of a needless $125 diagnostic fee. Also, (and there's a chance this could have been my fault) my appointment was mis-scheduled for a time when I was unavailable, so when I showed up with my car I wasn't booked in. They made it work which was good on them, but I felt like the whole exchange was a bit of a headache and left me feeling less than satisfied.

Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless they have absolutely no choice. I went in for an alignment and told them there's a lot of running and noise coming from those wheels that needed alignment and when I got it back the sound was way worse and when I called back they said they didn't notice anything and there's nothing they could do. This location is garbage

THE BOMBDIGGITY
Thats a word right? People say that.
Anyway this is my go to place for apology cup cakes, which, as a crass man I need more than I would like to admit.
But enough about me, cup cakes, good, other baked thing where good, I am really up for trying the peanut butter marshmallow squares, never had a cake there though

Went out for All You Can Eat sushi - great selection on the All You Can Eat Menu and everything we ordered was nothing short of amazingly delicious!! The service was also great - servers were eager to share their favourites and recommendations of items on the menu. We will definitely be back! :)

Absolutely fantastic. Everything you expect from a non chain place. Went there for lunch and found a quite place with all the locals enjoying lunch (a sign something is great). The food was good and ample letting me walk out full. I had the salmon steak with only one compliant...it was a little dry. But that was not a deal breaker. This is what I love about small non chain restaurants.

Paros on main is the best Greek food I've had. Ever. Their roasted potatoes have some kind of drug in them I'm sure. They are to die for. They have a fantastic menu and on certain days of the week they have belly dancers which is SUPER fun. If you go, you have to try the saganaki. Flaming cheese is where it is at, For sure. I love their Greek salad too it's so fresh and their dressing is dilly and light. If you manage to save to, try a Greek coffee, a slice of baklava, and a shot of ouzo.

Went with a few friends that were in town, as we have been before and had a decent experience. I ordered the veggie roll, after reading the menu to find it did not list yam/sweet potato in the ingredients. I am severely allergic. After eating two rolls, I was concerned so we asked the server if the roll had yam in the centre and she said yes. I said I was very allergic and they need to list their ingredients in the menu. She argued that the menu did include yam in the description. She went and grabbed a menu to confirm, and when she saw it in fact did not list yam, she showed me the picture, saying it's right there in the photo. Because apparently I am supposed to discern all ingredients from a picture. I ordered another dish - a yakisoba noodle which was terrible and just ichiban noodles. At the end of the meal, she asked if we wanted the veggie roll packed up, which obviously I didn't. And on top of all that,  she still charged us for the veggie rolls. Another member of our party also had an allergic reaction as they put all the rolls on one dish, so there was cross contamination. Needless to say we won't be returning.

I ordered from paros for delivery, paid $30 including tip for one beef skewer a bunch of gross rice and lettuce in the greek salad. Not too impressed about that. They didnt even supply a fork or a napkin in the bag. I had to go looking for one afterward. The delivery guy was nice enough to go to a gas station and get me one.

Gross... Went for lunch at 2pm and it was as if they made the food - no one came - they left it instead of make fresh food... Everything was hard and cold.. The dry robs were completely inedible... They just have you order from the menu if you want fresh.. So instead of paying you're basic 12-16$ for your meal, you have to pay double or triple... I gave no tip and if I wasn't so sick after my "meal" I would have made a fuss to have it for free... Most expensive place in town and the nastiest place in town... Go to Airdrie Wok... Its the cheapest and best Chinese in Airdrie
I live an hour out of Airdrie but gladly make the trip there. Fresh ingredients, a creative menu and wonderful service makes this place special. Love, love LOVE Sushi Haru.

Been here twice now and have been SUPER pleased both times. I don't give out 5 Stars very often 

The food is amazing. The calamari was perfect. The souvlaki (I've tried chicken and beef) is fantastic. All the sides, delicious. 

The staff is friendly, quick and efficient. Very professional. 

The decor is pleasantly tacky, I find it adds to the experience. A belly dancer walks around on the weekends. 

I look forward to trying every item on their menu! This review is to be continued!
Food was great, service was excellent.  Portions are huge and the Belly Dancers are a lot of fun.

Stopped in here at around 3am on a Sunday morning. They had about 5 doughnut options, almost all of which are the least popular. I understand that at 3am they're not going to be fully stocked, but you would think that they have more to choose from than the ones no one wants.

I skipped the doughnut and just got my tea and moved on. The tea was barely warm.
Worst Chinese ever. Buffet is gross!!!! If I could give a negative it would be -10.

Imagine going into a busy bakery on a Saturday afternoon, and being made to wait while the person being served ahead of you makes his choices. Never mind that there are three clerks behind the counter and you're the only other customer in the store, the clerk serving you tells you that you have to wait. It doesn't matter that you asked for that last delectable caramel-? cupcake, she's not going to put it into your package, she must wait until the person being served by the other clerk finishes choosing his assorted 12 cupcakes for a business function. Oh wait, switch out the last cupcake for that one there, that caramel-? cupcake. And so I lost it. Never got to taste that caramel-? cupcake that I asked for two minutes ahead of the other guy.

And that's how it went for me the one and only time I was in this bakery. Thanks a lot, clerk-who-is-the-owner's-daughter, it still rankles that you served in such a cockamamie fashion. I have never been served in that illogical fashion in my 55 years, and I hope your mother set you straight about how, in a busy shop, one clerk serves one customer while the other two clerks serve the other customers concurrently, and nobody has to wait, unless there's a fourth and a fifth customer.

Get a brain.

I go there for the steak. I really love that steak. People are friendly and I for sure will go there again. But I've done a lot of deliveries for them and every time I walk into their kitchen to pick up a delivery, I see at least 2 people smoking and cooking. Kitchen isn't the cleanest either. But I just try not to think about that when I eat. Just can't help cause i love their steak

Super delicious! Bought half doz cupcakes. I just asked for a variety. I had the sweet potatoe. It was the best cupcake I've ever had. And I've had Sprinkles at The Grove. 

They had a great assortment of slices and squares. This will defiantly be my go to for fab cupcakes and baked goods. 

It was worth the drive from Calgary.

Great little local bakery that everyone raves about~ I thought I would give it a try and since I was hosting an upcoming baby shower it was the perfect opportunity. 

I thought I had left plenty of time prior to the event to get 2 dozen custom cupcakes made. Enough time for cupcakes, yes. Enough for custom cupcakes, nope. I was pretty disappointed since I have seen their beautiful cake designs. But I guess it was my mistake. 

I ordered both vanilla and chocolate cupcakes and they dressed them with a light blue icing for the celebration theme. I took them home and decorated them myself with supplies from a craft store.  I must have saved some money not having them custom done which was a blessing in disguise since I didn't ask the price when I ordered them and was shocked (knock me over with a feather kind of shock) when I paid. But again I didn't ask when I ordered so once again, my fault.

The cupcakes were a hit at the party with many people giving their compliments. I would have passed them off as my own except there was the bakery box evidence that I did not dispose of ;-) 

To summarize, I didn't get what I wanted and had to pay the gross domestic product of a small country to get it, both being my own fault and lesson learned. BUT everyone loved the cupcakes (I can't review the taste as I don't like cupcakes and didn't eat one) and that is ultimatley what matters most.

Stopped in as its close to home. Some good deals on everyday items. Fruit/vegetables can be iffy. Lots of items on sale and it shows the regular price as well.

No self checkout, but they supply boxes for groceries. 

Why do you need a loonie to get a cart?

This Tim's location is more of a public safety hazard than a fast-food restaurant. The store is almost always busy, and during peak hours, the drive-through obstructs traffic in both directions on Main St, and parking can be difficult if not impossible due to the poor set-up of the drive-through. While the coffee and donuts are usually fresh, it could still take you 15 minutes or more to get your Double Double if you hit this place at the wrong time.

Went here for a work luncheon. Food was great especially the potatoes. Had a wrap type meal and it was good, sauce was great. Ended up with food on my lap multiple times.

Wasnt very busy and food seemed to be slow, but how good it was made up for the wait.

Short of Hawai'i this is some of the best sushi I have ever had. The staff is friendly, I have had the occasional meal take a while to come out but that is normal for any restaurant when they get busy. I have eaten here at least once a month for close to a year now and will keep going back.

Probably the best restaurant in Airdrie, and one of the best Greek restaurants I've ever been to. It's almost always quiet at night, and the servers are very good. Meals are very well priced, and with large portions. Entrees all come with Greek or Caesar salad and rice or potatoes. I'd easily recommend this to anyone.

A hidden Jem! One of the best sushi places I've been too, super fast, fresh, and clean. The servers were so nice and always make you feel at home. Super kid friendly.  Always reccomend this if people are in the area :)

Don't let the location of the little Mexican gem deter you. The food is absolutely authentic and so so so good. From the tv playing Mexican rock videos to the retro decor the place is a home run. 

The owners are super friendly and engaging. For Mexican food in Airdrie this HAS TO BE you go to location.

This is a no frills store, alright.  I've driven by a dozen times and finally stopped in yesterday.  It's like a mini Superstore.  Many products are President's Choice and No Name.  There's no bakery or deli, but there is a pharmacy and basically anything you'd need for groceries.  I wandered most of the isles and did pick up a few things.  From what I can tell, most prices are the same as Superstore but various items are cheaper, such as salad dressings and some meats.  I didn't scour the fruit and vegetables area.  

There is no self check-out but the store wasn't very busy, so the line I did wait in didn't last long.  

I'd say that if you're in the neighborhood, it's worth a browse for some good deals.  I'm already a Superstore shopper, so this place isn't really worth the effort.  However, for those who shop elsewhere, you'll likely be shocked at some of the low prices.

4/30 for Yelp's 30 Day Challenge

Been here a few times - I love this place. Reasonable prices, friendly staff and a great place for groups. I love the different variety of choice over the other sushi restaurants. Will continue to come back!

The food here was absolutely incredible.  The staff was helpful in making decisions for what to eat.  I have only been here a few times but will definitely be going back.  The decor definitely leaves a bit to be desired but has a cozy feel.  The reason for the 4/5 is that the food service is a little slow so i wouldn't recommend Paros if you have other places to be unless you get there plenty early.  Once the food arrives however be ready to stretch your stomach muscles as you will get more than enough food.  I highly recommend the Mixed Grill for a first time visitor, and the Kalamari (fried squid) and Saganaki (Flaming Cheese) are both amazing appetizers.  All in all a great place if you have time to sit down and have a great meal with family or friends.

This is the best Japanese restaurant in the Calgary area.  Their food is of high quality (serving size, flavor, freshness) - their rolls have thin rice so you taste the flavor of the filling.  Service is great - friendly staff and they accommodate special requests (food not on their menu).  We've been going here for years and everything stays awesome!

I've been here more times than I can count and not once have I been disappointed! Friendly, lively staff that seem to genuinely love working there and food that feels as good in your stomach as it does on your tongue all for the price of a McDonalds combo!

we purchased new carpet at Lowes crossiron mills back in November.  was supposed to be installed on dec 3 but instead they installed it in the wrong house. yes wrong house.  not even an apology came from any of the managers i talked with after this until i asked for one and that no one had said anything.  everyone pointing fingers at everyone else.  we didnt get the call until late the night before.  by then we had already taken half of the house apart as we were told all furniture had to be removed as well as all the doors. so in the end we would have to do that all twice.  a lot of work.  all the managers cared about was if we were going to order the carpet again.  as we didnt have much choice at this time as we were having our wedding reception and then leaving for our honeymoon we ordered another batch of carpet.  we were now put on ignore mode by everyone at the store. when carpet did arrive one guy showed up to install.  he showed up very late and without tools which he left at a different job.  he had not showered in days it seemed and the body odor smell took 2 days to get out of our house.  he damaged several walls in the process and did just an ok job of the install.  we had to pay to repair and repaint damaged walls.  Lowes managers thought it was a good idea to have the carpet installer come back in and repair the walls.  not sure how it was a good idea to have a mediocre carpet installer repair walls?  maybe he could come put in an air conditioner while he's here????  so after nearly 2 months of dealing with these lowes managers and everyone passing along to the next because they say they have no authority they offered gift cards to their store.  not only can we not even really use them as we have not much need for anymore home improvement items,  lowes did nothing in this process to have us want to deal with them as customers anymore anyway.  likely offering gift cards does not come out of their bottom line to much and really only costing them 30-50% of the value of the card if that.  must be some bonuses attached to some of this stuff for these managers.  such a minuscule amount you would thing in the big business of lowes.

I had lunch here last week and it was the best overall dining experience I have had while visiting Airdrie in terms of accommodating, friendly service, good quality, freshness and taste, portion size and pricing. It was so good, I returned for dinner. Prices are higher at dinner for what seems to be the same portion. Service was not as attentive and friendly as it had been at lunch, but everything else was great. Great tasting, fresh food, reasonably priced. I'll definitely return.
